betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§lME Interfaces§r are the doorways to the ME system from machines and devices in the world.  Items can be piped into it from hoppers or other means, and they will be assimilated into the ME storage cells if there is sufficient room.

  They can also be configured to buffer certain items, allowing hoppers, pipes, etc. to passively pull from the ME system.  Place the items you wish to buffer in the top row of the §lInterface§r's GUI.  You can adjust the quantity of the items by having the same number of items in-hand, so if you wanted a full stack of coal, you'd place a full stack of coal in a slot in the top row.  To clear the buffer's configuration, simply left click on the respective item in the top row.

Note: The output buffer (items going out of the ME system) shares the same inventory space as the input buffer, so be sure to leave at least one slot clear if you want to use the same interface for both input and output.

  More features of the Interface will be covered in other quests where they are relevant.

Tip:  ME Interfaces also have a multipart  or "flat panel" version.  You can toggle between the two types by simply tossing the Interface into a crafting grid by itself.  However, this version will not power the device it is attached to, nor will it connect to devices other than what it is attached to.
Craft all cakes and eat them.
Craft a cake and eat it.
Craft Pumpkin Pie, Steak & Baked Potato.
With the Sink placed in your kitchen multi-block, you'll be able to craft unlimited Fresh Water to use in recipes. This can also be done with milk, if you can somehow get a cow inside a jar.
You store things in your multi-block kitchen by adding Fridges and Kitchen Counters to it. Try it out!
Craft a cup of coffee.
Craft a Coffee Maker.
Craft one of every smoothie.
Craft one of every juice.
Craft Supreme Pizza.
Roll some Sushi.
Craft Popcorn & Cola Soda.
Craft one of every jelly.

Cooking for Blockheads is a mod designed to make food crafting a lot easier. To get started, craft a Cooking Table. Clicking the Cooking Table will open a crafting menu. This menu shows you which food items you can craft, with what you have in your inventory, and what's connected to the Cooking Table. You connect things to the table, by placing them next to it. All blocks from the mod has this feature, meaning you can make a multi-block kitchen. You'll quickly notice, that there's not much you can make without tools. Make some tools like the pot, and place them in a Tool Rack next to your multi-block kitchen.
Craft some snack food.
Craft one of every ice cream.
Craft one of every sandwich.
Craft a Pam's tree, by crafting 3 food ingredients with a sapling. The saplings have to be either oak or jungle.
Make soy, and use a presser to convert it into soy milk, silken tofu & firm tofu.

Just Enough Items is a mod that allows you to easily look up the recipe of a specific item as well as any recipe that uses it.

There are 2 ways to do this. Firstly,pressing the Recipe hotkey (default R) or the Usage hotkey (default U) while hovering over an item in your inventory will open a window containing all ways to craft this particular item or all recipes that uses this particular item (with R and U respectively). While in this window, you may look up further recipes or usages by respectively left or right clicking while hovering any particular item displayed in any recipe.

As an added benefit, clicking the category's name will bring up the complete list of recipes.

The other way of bringing up those menus is through the search bar. To open it, press CTRL + O (by default) while in your inventory, then bottom left you can enter the name of the item or block you're looking up. Once you see the item in the list, just either use R/U or left/right clicking to see its recipes and usages as you would do if it was in your inventory.

Lastly, searching for words with a @ before them will search for mod ids instead of item names. For example, searching "@minecraft" (without quotes) will bring up all items from vanilla Minecraft.

A Trade-o-mat can be used to set up item for item trades between players. From the IndustrialCraft Wiki: 'Simply put a itemstack of your choice into the marked (left, with the lock symbol) input slot and another itemstack into the output one. Then place a Chest (or Personal Safe, to protect your money) nearby and fill it the same item the Trade-O-Mat is configured to output. They no longer need to be equal in number. Any player (including yourself), can drop items into the public input slot (on the right). It will then be added to the chest, and the output will be taken from the chest and placed in the output slot.'

This tome allows you to rapidly store your levels in it for later use, or withdraw levels to use in enchanting. This allows you to not waste high levels on lower-level enchantments, and safeguards you in case of death.

It will automatically absorb experience you gather while it is in your inventory.

Living armor is powerful protection that will evolve to fit your needs. It will remember key events such as taking damage or sprinting/jumping a lot and spend its upgrade points automatically to aid you with helpful traits.

There are several rituals available to cleanse your armor of unwanted buffs or inflict it with curses in order to increase its capabilities further. See the Sanguine Scientiem for details!

This armor can permanently break, but it can be repaired with binding agent in an anvil (or learn to slowly repair itself).

A full set of armor is required for it to work.

Bound tools can be activated by shift + right click. They are already uniquely powerful, but feature a chargable right-click for massive clearing capabilities, extending in all directions and upwards!

Using these tools draws upon your life network - or your lifeforce, should you run out. Use with caution!
Make your own custom banner, by making a banner and crafting it along with coloured wool in various ways. Additional details can be found at: http://www.minecraft101.net/r/banners.html
Craft a bunch of non-red beds, so guests can stay at your place.

Sentient weapons run off demonic will, but also collect it from slain foes. They are uniquely useful in charging your tartaric gems, and grow in power as your ability to store will does.

Furthermore, the type of will you have the most of will influence the abilities of the sword.

You have finally unlocked a way to make demonic will useable to defend yourself as well.

Sentient Armor can be summoned by using a sentient gem. It will replace your currently worn set, taking over any active enchantments, and provide defense based in your currently held will. It will also consume will to repair itself, so be careful that you do not run out.

Using the gem again will return your original armor set.

Sentient armor will not take over enhancements from living armor - though it will accept its magical enchantments.

Sometimes a little creative alchemy is required in order to produce the materials you need. This table provides you with ample options.

In order to work, it requires a blood orb and enough LP in your network. You may check the requirements by hovering over the arrow in the recipe.
By the power of your demonic will and blood network combined, perhaps you can further increase the power of your living armor...

Through the power of blood, normal potions become but trivial childs play.

You have long since unlocked the power of multiple use potion flasks.

The incense altar is an item that can be incorporated into a multiblock structure in order to aid your self-sacrifice. You can check the current benefit with a sigil of divination. It should start at 20% and may add up to 300%!

Later tiers will feature a value of "tranquility", which can also be seen with the sigil. Tranquility is gained by having different kind of blocks in the radius of the altar.

In order to expand the alter into a multiblock, you need to place 3 blocks wide paths going from the 3 x 3 it is placed on, rising in tier as the distance to the altar increases.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Extend your altar by placing 3 x 3 blocks of wooden path in every cardinal direction. This will allow you to include the first blocks for a tranquility bonus.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Extend your altar by lengthening the pathways with 2 x 3 stone paths for an even higher tranquility area.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

A Trade Station can be used to set up item for item trades between players. From the FTB Wiki: 'In a trade station players or operators can setup "trading posts" to let other players automatically trade items through the mailbox system. The owner of the Trade Station provides a name for their Trade Station, then adds stamps and paper for postage. Add the items that cover the cost of the trade (an example would be for a Macerator in one slot, and then Induction Furnace as what the player will receive from the trade.)  The player then adds further inventory for the Trade Station to pull stock from. For a player to do business with a Trade Station over mail order, a player must have a mailbox of their own placed. The player must open up a blank envelope by right clicking and select the envelope icon in the interface - this will change to a dollar sign for trade stations. The player then will put in the name of the Trade Station desired to do business with. If the name is put in properly, it will prompt the player to include the indicated price per unit of items received. The player then attaches the items and appropriate postage and mails it. Within moments, the person who owns or manages the Trade Station will receive a notice letting them know the trade has been carried out, and the person placing the order will receive their package.'

Extend your alter by lengthening the pathways with 2 x 3 worn stone brick paths.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Take your incense altar to the maximum with 2 x 3 extensions of your pathways, using obsidian brick paths.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

The Demon Crucible can smelt down Demonic Will, either raw or contained in Tartaric Gems, and release it into the chunk it occupies.

The will of a chunk can also be drained again by putting a Tartaric Gem into an unoccupied Hellfire Forge.

This opens a few options for a creative magus...

The Demon Crystalizer can drain the demonic will in the chunk in order to confine it to small nodes of crystals. These nodes take a lot of will to initially grow, but require much less to grow additional crystals, giving you a small net gain should you melt them in the Demon Crucible.

They may be broken with a sufficiently powerful pickaxe, but a powerful magus with more than 1024 will in his inventory may find that right-clicking the node allows him to take off crystals without breaking the main node.

Too long have you dabbled in crude raw will.

The Resonance of the Faceted Crystal Ritual will allow you to finally distill the different kinds of will from your fully grown crystal clusters.

Having these kind of wills stored in Tartaric Gems in your inventory will influence your sentient tools, weapons and armor, whereas melting them in the Demon Crucible will enable you to influence your rituals held in the same chunk with their aura.

The Demon Pylon allows you to draw in will from surrounding chunks that have more total will than the one the Pylon is placed in.

A handy tool for distributing will, especially considering automatization with rituals.

Welcome to Ancient Warfare, a mod that will allow you to spawn and control your own NPCs, have a very handy item storage, and its own uniquely-themed power system using torque! Ultimately, it will allow you to build your own villages, castles, and even kingdoms.

The mod comes with in-game documentation given to you as you begin this questline.

§0§r§r§r§rTo progress through the mod, the very first thing you need to craft is your research book.

The book will be bound to you. You will transcribe your research into it using a research station, unlocking more advanced recipes as you invest ressources.

Next, you will need a research station to do some actual research. First have a look at the research you want to do in your book, then insert it into the research station to see the requirements for inscribing it.

Afterwards, you will discover that despite doing the research, crafting still does not appear to be working. That is because you need an engineering station, with your research book in it, to craft the recipes from this mod. No other crafting bench will do, accept no substitutes!

Before you get started on NPCs, first you will have to get a town hall to feed them.

Think of it as a communal banquet table where everyone can come and get their fill. NPCs without food will stop working, soldiers will only attack in self-defense, and all health regeneration is disabled. Tend to the needs of your subjects, my liege!

An important secondary use of the town hall is its aura of protection. This will cover a large radius around the town hall and allow your priests to resurrect any of your NPCs that have died. An easy way to check if anyone has died is to look into the death list - but do not clear it while someone is ressurectable, or they will be lost for good.

NPC items are dropped at site of death and not retrained. That means all your revived NPCs will be generic workers, though they will retain their level.

Today your first step towards your own kingdom begins!

But before you can attract subjects, you must first show them you have the means to feed them. This requires crafting a food bundle, displaying your lavish food variety. It shall enable them to make the arduous journey from their homeland to here. Onwards!

A town hall is good and all, but at some point it does become a little crowded. Would it not be nice for your subjects to have their own little houses, and gather their food from places other than the town hall?

Use the Z key to bind the upkeep order to an inventory you are looking at. Then give the order to an NPC and he will try to get his food there from now on. This enables you to have them take food from a chest inside their own house, for instance, and can save much travel time that would otherwise impact their labour for the kingdom.

Crop farms! What would your kingdom be without food, farmed by the noble peasantry with honest labour. Simply give one of your workers a hoe (of the gardening variety), and surely enough he shall tend to the nearest crop farm.

Crop farms work with most plantable seeds from other mods.

Of course, your citizens require buildings to live in. What better way to provide for said need than to employ a sturdy lumberjack. He sleeps all night and works all day! Just equip one of your workers with an axe, and off he goes.

A tree farm will work with most, but not all saplings. It will also collect drops from the trees, though depending on the time of day, they will not have much time to grow past the initial spawn.

While animal products are needed for a happy populace, it is ill-fitting for a king of your esteem to tend to them yourself. Enter the animal farm!

Your farmers will keep the populace at the desired level (which you may input at the farm), all the while breeding them with the items you provide (wheat, carrots, seeds). All drops such as eggs will also be automatically collected!

Milk is not collected automatically. Should you have need of a good source for milk, look into the "cow in a bottle" recipe.

For those kind of kings who like to spare the rod, the fishing rod that is, now you may have your subjects take care of hauling in the bounties of the ocean. Your farmers usually do not mind taking care of the fish farms as well as the crop farms.

Fish farms will catch all kind of fish, items, and even enchanted books. Remember you can convert most mod-fishes back into vanilla minecraft ones by crafting them.
There are a ton of different bees in the world. To find them you'll have to look carefully in trees and on the ground - Or you can breed them once you have a few.
There are a ton of different bees in the world. To find them you'll have to look carefully in trees and on the ground - Or you can breed them once you have a few.

Local farms are nice and all, but as your kingdom grows, so must your farms in order to supply for the larger populace.

Simply use this item on a farm of your choice to extend its maximum bounds (do not forget to actually increase it afterwards).

Taking your farms to new heights, this is the maximum size any non-quarry farm can be upgraded to.

Quarries have their own size upgrades (due to much more land being required to make them truely useful).

Increase the output of your farms by having it use enchanted tools. 

It will automatically harvest using the appropriate "Looting" or "Fortune" enchantments.
There are a ton of different bees in the world. To find them you'll have to look carefully in trees and on the ground - Or you can breed them once you have a few.

Further increase efficiency and yield of your farms with these maximum capacity enchantments.

After all, who will a peasant blame, if not his tools?

Every machine needs power, but putting a generator next to every machine is not fun! Use the cables to transfer your power around! 
NOTE: The Universal Cables can have a lot of trouble connecting to non-Mekanism machines, so it is recommended to use other cables (like Thermal Expansion) for cross-mod machines.
Almost every machine in every mod needs power, and Mekanism is no different. Create a simple power generator, to feed your machines
All these machines with settings and chests with lots of stuff, and you're moving base. If only there was something to help you out here...
The Precision Sawmill increases your Wood Planks output by 50%, for a bit of power. And it gives you its leftovers as well! So very kind of it
All the items that didn't quite fit in any other category or path

Need your fluids elsewhere? Or maybe in your machines? 
Fear no more, the Mechanical Pipes are here to save you!

The fluid pump of Mekanism. 
Needs to be placed above a source block, and it will drain anything connected with that source block. 
Power input from behind. Output is above. 
The pump can be upgraded with a Filter, to get Heavy Water
With better power generation, comes better wires and storage. Upgrade your old wires and storage, and step up your power game! Also upgrade your other pipes for items/fluids/gasses
You have now gotten the basics of Mekanism, and is ready to step up your game a bit
Basic fluid storage. Will keep its contents when broken. Can input or output from every side (not both at once).
Passive power generation. Who doesn't like passive power generation? Make sure to put this up high, where the wind is windier!

When looking in a machine interface, you will see Side Config in the top left. 
In the Side Config, you can configure each side to Input or Output (or Extra/Power/None). To automate the machine with other machines/chests, you need to set Auto-Eject to On, by clicking the "A" in the top right. Around the interface, you can also select Config for Fluid/Gas/Power, depending on the machine. 
Mekanism has no In/Out setting, it's either In OR Out. Or None.

The Enrichment Chamber is Mekanisms ore doubler, but is also used in all 4 tiers of Mekanism ore processing (up to quintuple (5) output). 
The Enrichment Chamber can also increase the efficiency of infusion materials, and increase their effectivenes by x8. So for example, an enriched piece of Redstone will count as 8 pieces of Redstone in the Metallurgic Infuser

The Metallurgic Infuser is the most basic Mekanism machine, and you will need this machine a lot. 
The Metallurgic Infuser is used to create the most basic Alloys and Circuits, but also the most advanced alloys.  
The Infuse materials can be octuplied (times 8) in an Enrichment Chamber.

After ores have gone through the Purification Chamber, it needs to go through a Crusher. After the Crusher, it has to go through the Ore Doubling setup.
Your total ore processing setup should now be Purification Chamber -> Crusher -> Enrichment Chamber -> Smelter

You have gotten your Ore Doubling, but that is not enough! 
The Purification Chamber is the beginning of your ore trippling. The Purification Chamber will need Oxygen from the Electrolytical Separator.
A standard Furnace that runs on power. Can be used to smelt ore dust, cook food and anything you would expect a normal furnace to do.

If you don't know how to find the OreDict for different items, the Dictionary is here to help you out. 
Simply right click any block in the world, and it will tell you its OreDict key (if it has any). 
For items that are not blocks, you can shift-right click with the Dictionary, and put items into its slot to get the OreDict key.

Found 5 different variations of fx. Copper Ingot from dungeon chests, that's filling up your storage space? 
The Oredictionificator can unify them into the same type of Copper Ingot. This is done by entering the oreDict key of the thing you want to convert, and selecting which variation you want (Smelt its ore, to see which one is the default). 
Check the next quest on how to find oreDicts

This is the starting point of Mekanism, where you will get your first basic machines. 
You will need some basic resources to get started
What is a mod with custom ores without custom armor? Osmium armor is really durable, and is on a level between Iron and Diamond, which makes for a really good early game solution
Ever wanted a TNT with a bit more... TNT? You might wanna take an extra step back on this one though..

Mekanism likes to use shortcuts when it comes to power display, rather than raw numbers, and they're not all obvious. So here they are: 
KRF = Thousand RF (1.000)
MRF = Million RF      (1.000.000)
GRF = Billion RF       (1.000.000.000)
TRF = Trillion RF      (1.000.000.000.000)
PRF = Quadtrillion RF (1.000.000.000.000.000)
ERF = Quintillion RF    (1.000.000.000.000.000.000)
ZRF = Sextillion RF     (1.000.000.000.000.000.000.000) 
So for a few examples: 1.6 KRF = 1.600 RF. 16.27 GRF = 16.270.000.000 RF, or as most mods likes to display it: 16.270M RF
With all that gas going about, you need a way to store it

Electrolytical Separator is one of your main gas-producing machines. 
It takes in liquid from the front, and outputs to the sides. 
Every separatable liquid will separate into 2 gasses, and which side they will export to is fixed, so you need to plan for that. 
You can look up the sides in JEI, by looking at the "Item Uses". 
You can also fuel Jet Packs and Gas Tanks directly in the Electrolytical Separator.

You know your mom always told you not to play with fire, but she can't stop you now! 
The Flamethrower will need Hydrogen from the Electrolytical Separator

As the machines progresses on, you may start to notice that your coal is disappearing, and start looking into other power options.
If you have a good agriculture setup, with either wheat, or even sapling, there are ways to turn those into power.
The Crusher can crush organic material into Bio Fuel, which can be used to power certain machines.
Check the next quest for the Generator.

I will recommend setting up some Bio Fuel, as its very useful for a bigger power source in Part 2

Your Coal problems are now solved, when you can generate a bit of power with self-replenishing solutions.
The Bio-Generator uses Bio Fuel from the Crusher to generate some power. With automatic farming from other mods, you can have a very good, self-sufficient power source early on.

Flight! Well, it's not true flight, like creative flight, but it's flight nontheless! 
The Jetpack requires Hydrogen to fly, which you get from the Electrolytical Separator. You can fuel it directly in the Electrolytical Separator, or from a Gas Tank. 
The Jetpack also has an Armored version.

Free Runners will absorb all of your fall damage, you could get from flying a tad too high with your Jetpack. They do require power to absorb the damage though. 
You power them by standing on a powered Charge Pad

The Configurator is the Wrench of Mekanism, and has a few functions. Lets start off with wires. 
Right clicking on a Wire/Pipe/Tube, will turn its Redstone Sensitivity on or off. While on, the cable will be disabled while gaining a redstone signal. If you shift-right click on the connecting points, you can change the wires side to be either PUSH, PULL, NONE or NORMAL. For cross-mod interaction, it can often be a requirement for it to be set to PULL to accept items.
For Logistical Pipes, it can set a color to the pipe when you shift-right click on its center, which is used to direct items a certain direction with the Logistical Sorter. 
The Configurator can also config the sides of machines, without having to enter the GUI. By default, it will change side config for Item Transfers, however you can change its function with its default keybind M (You may need to rebind that), in case a machine has more than 1 type of in/output (like Items, Fluids, Gas, Heat, Energy). But, if a machine only has fx Fluid Output, it will always config the fluid output, no matter the current function. 
The Configurator also has a Wrench function, which can rotate machines on right click and break machines and wires on shift-right click. Again, press M (or your rebound key) to get to it.
With all that gas going about, you need a way to safely transport it
Feeling your machines are running slow? Good thing there's upgrades for those things! Upgrades stack up to 8 times (Muffling stacks to 4, with 4 being completely silent)

Very simple RF powered auto-crafter. Materials can be inserted manually or through pipes into its internal buffer. 
For the Formulaic Assemblicator to craft anything, it needs a Crafting Formula inserted into it (so yes, it can only craft 1 thing at a time). 
You set up the recipe in the Formulic Assemblicator, put in a Crafting Formula and Encode the pattern. 
You can now use it to craft that item, either automatically, or when you tell it to.
The basic energy storage for Mekanism

Damn right it's a balloon! 
Those can be used for cosmetic purposes, or they can keep mobs in place. 
Right click with the balloon, and you will let go of it, and it will fly up till its heart desires. Or freezes up in the atmosphere.
Shift-Right Click with it, and you will place it on the ground, or on a mob. 
Putting a balloon on a mob will make it hover above the ground, unable to move. Can still be pushed around

A locked chest or a backpack? Why not both. 
This chest is a double-chest, that can be placed on the ground, or opened while it's in your hand. Very handy for long trips

Tired of setting up the same configuration on every machine, because they happen to have the same input/output?
With the Configuration Card, you can shift-right click on a Machine to copy its settings (all of them), and then right click on a Machine to paste them.
This only works on machines of the same type.

Now that you've drained up a lot of water, maybe you want to fill up a lake? Lets get going shall we? 
It will fill up everything below it with a source block, with the liquid you give it. 
Power goes in from behind, fluid inputs from above (recommending pipes)..

Note: The Fluidic Plenisher can check and place a maximum of 4000 souce blocks, before it stops, so it needs to be moved after that.

Ever wanted to take a long swim? 
With the Diving Gear, you can go on for ages! Given you don't run out of Oxygen that is - or get blasted by a Guardian. 
This diving gear will need Oxygen from an Electrolytical Separator

Ever had some leftover gas/liquid in a machine that you can't remove because you can't pull it out? 
The Gauge Dropper can remove gas/liquid from any Mekanism machines input or output slot, and either insert it into another input or output slot, or void it. 
Simply click the Gas/Liquid with the Gauge Dropper in the machine interface (like you're about to Drag-n'-drop it) to extract it, and right click to insert it (given it is in the correct input/output slot). 
You can also Shift-Click with it on a gas/liquid to void all its stored contents in that slot, or shift-right click with it to void its own contents.

Got too many stacks of Cobblestone, and big chests are just kind of meh? 
The Bins can only store 1 kind of item at a time, but they can store an absurd amount of that 1 item. And it can be upgraded too, to store even more!

Steel is an important part of Mekanism. 
Steel Blend is created in the Metallurgic Infuser with 1 Iron and 2 Coal. Infuse the Iron with 1 Coal to get Enriched Iron, then infuse that with Coal again, to get Steel Blend. 
Smelt that Steel Blend to get Steel Ingots
betterquesting:10.name:8: But can jet fuel melt it?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Logistical Sorter and Logistical Pipes are your main item transfer method in Mekanism. 
The Logistical Sorter has options to output specific items to specific colors channels, or if you want it to output everything, enable Auto-Eject. 
RR (Round Robin) will split all items evenly to multiple destinations. 
You can also set up Filters for specific items (either Specific, OreDict, Material or Mod ID). 
For Specific, you have to drag an item into its item slot. 
For OreDict, you either drag an item, or write the OreDict key of the items you want to move. You can also specify it to take fx everything that has "ore" in its OreDict (like every Ore does), by writing the Key like "ore*". Also works for stuff like "ingot*", "chest*" etc. 
For Material, you place an item, and it will extract all items related to the material (ie Oak Planks Material will extract stuff like Oak Chest, Oak Slabs, Oak Stairs etc). NOTE: Only placable blocks can be used as Material. 
For ModID, you have to specify the name of the mod, by going with its ID Name (like "minecraft" for vanilla, "thermalexpansion" for Thermal Expansion, and so on). 
Each filter can be assigned to a Color. Setting colors will be covered in the Configurator quest
betterquesting:10.name:8: You go there, you go there..

betterquesting:10.desc:8: Harnesing the power of the sun!.. in an advanced way!
Harnesing the power of the sun!

Why have 3 machines when you can just have 1? 
Basic Factories have 3 processing slots, so it can run 3 operations at once, but also with a higher power cost. 

The Crafting Task will show Basic Smelting Factory to be required, but any Basic Factory will do
Ever wondered exactly how much power flows through your wires? How much fluid or gas goes through the pipes? Use this to take a little read on the network!

Thermal Evaporation Plants (TEP) uses heat, either generated from machines, or from the sun. It can turn Water into Brine, or Brine into Lithium. 
To build the TEP, you need to make a 4x4 solid base out of Thermal Evaporation Blocks, then make walls (with corners) on top of that base with Thermal Evaporation Blocks. 
On the structure, you will need 1 Controller and at least 2 Valves. The corner blocks MUST be Thermal Evaporation Blocks. It has a minimum height of 3 blocks (incl the base) and a max height of 17 (incl the solar panels). 
There's 2 ways for the TEP to generate heat. It can either collect heat by itself, which depends on biome (Desert is best). You can speed up heat collection by putting Advanced Solar Panels on top, on the corners, with Thermal Evaporation Blocks in between. It must be daytime for it to collect Heat. 
Alternatively you can pump in Heat with Fuelwood or Resistive Heaters. This does require an additional Valve to be attatched to the TEP, but eliminates the night cycle and biome problems. 
The height of the TEP increases its in and output buffer, but also increases the amount of heat it can hold, and thus increasing the production rate. 

TEP does, unlike every other multiblock structure, not accept Structural Glass

You have learned the advanced ways of Mekanism, but there is still more! It's time for The Elite part. As things gets more complex, this does also mean that there will be a big cut in "funny" descriptions, and be more explanation.
Time to upgrade your wires and pipes once again!

The Fusion Reactor needs 2 types of fuel, and Tritium is one of them. 
First you need to make Liquid Lithium, which you make in a Thermal Evaporation Plant, but, instead of pumping Water into it, you want to pump Brine into it. 
So you will need 2 Thermal Evaporation Plants.

You have gone through the steps of The Elite, but there is still the last part - The Ultimate! This contains the most lategame of Mekanism, including its most powerful power generation and storage, and Quintuple Ore Processing

The Quantum Entangloporters are for your long-range transport of either items, power, fluids or gasses (Heat seems to be non-functional in Mekanism 9.2).
To get started with it, place it down and assign it either a public or private channel (pipes wont connect otherwise). 
This QE has all the Side Configs available, and everything (including Energy) has Auto-push set to Off, so make sure to set all of them to On, if it's your output QE. 
The stats of the QE is (as per Mekanism 9.2, MC1.10.2): 
1 item per second
6.4 Million RF/t
256 mb/t gas/fluid. 
This limit is per channel, so you can't have 2 pairs of QEs to transfer 800k RF/t on the same channel. You can still have 2 pairs of QEs on 2 different channels to transfer 800k RF/t.

The final stage of Mekanism Ore Processing, and overall it's going to be a big setup. The Quintuple Ore Processing adds 3 steps of processing the ores, and 4 steps of gas production. 
The gas production is covered in the linked quests. 
For the ore processing, it goes through the Chemical Dissolution Chamber, where Sulfuric Acid (left gas input) and ores (top item input) are added.
Then outputs (right gas output) to the Chemical Washer where Water is added (top fluid input)
Then outputs (right gas output) to the Chemical Crystalizer (right item output). 
After the Crystalizer, it has to go through the Quadruple Ore Processing and down. 
NOTE: You may want a x5 set for every processable ore (7 different ores in 9.2.2), as it may not use all the fluids when fully upgraded.

Now that you have Sulfur Trioxide, it's time to add the final ingredient in the next Chemical Infuser! Water Vapor. 
Mix it with the Sulfur Trioxide to get Sulfuric Acid (gas). The Sulfuric Acid goes into the Chemical Dissolution Chamber along with the ores.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Mix it up with some vapors..

betterquesting:10.desc:8: Add some Oxygen to the Sulfur Dioxide in the Chemical Infuser, outputs Sulfur Trioxide (gas) at front.

The main ingredient for Sulfuric Acid is... Sulfur. 
Put Sulfur in the Chemical Oxydizer to get Sulfur Dioxide (gas). 
Item Input is on the left, top or bottom. Gas output is on the Right

The Auto-Miner/Quarry of Mekanism. It can be specified to mine everything, or specific things. 
It takes power from the sides, outputs in the back, and takes in filler blocks above. 
It can mine with Silk Touch for an increased power cost, and fill in mined blocks, if you provide it with filler blocks. 
What it mines is defined in its Filters in the Config section. 
It's configuration works a lot like the Logistical Sorter, where it can sort by ItemID, OreDict, Material or ModID. For an explanation on those, check the Logistical Sorter quest. 
In the Config Screen, you can also set its Min and Max mining height, and its mining radius. 
When chaning these values, you MUST click the Check Marker or Enter to apply the changes. 
The Digital Miner has a maximum radius of 32 blocks, and goes from y0 to y255. 
Click Start to start it, Stop to stop it, and click "R (Reset)", if you want to change its configuration. Click the "S" to toggle Silk Touch, "A" for Auto-Eject to back chest, "P" to Auto-Pull from top chest, in case of block-filling.

The Rotary Condensentrator (RC) can turn Liquid into Gas, and vice versa. 
The RC is side specific for Gas/Liquid in/output. 
The small (left when placed in front) connection is for Gas, the big (right when placed in front) connection is for Liquid. You can also just see if the cable connects or not. 
In the GUI you can switch its conversion function. Condensentrating for Gas to Liquid, and De-Condensentrating for Liquid to Gas. 
There is no Auto-Eject with the RC, so to pull from it, you will have to use the Configurator to set your output pipe to PULL.

[This quest chain focuses on HDPE Pellets] 
Pressurized Reaction Chamber is used to create Ethylene, Substrate and HDPE Pellets from Biofuel. 
Its first function is creating Substrate from Biofuel, Hydrogen and Water, with Ethylene (gas) as a side product. 
You may want to configure the in/output sides on the PRC. 
The Substrate and Ethylene is going to be used in the following quests.

Multiblock structure that allows you to teleport between Teleporter setups. 
The structure is a Teleporter at the bottom middle, with a 3x1x4 frame. The Teleporter does require power to function, but uses very little per teleport. 
To set up the teleporters, you need to set it to a Frequency (or make one), and then set the other end to the same Frequency to link them. 
More than 2 Teleporters linked to the same Frequency can be wonky, so you might want to have an Entrance and an Exit portal at each location (if you have more than 2 locations)

To start the Fusion Reactor itself, there are serveral things that needs to be in order. 
Almost all of these are covered by quests, the rest are here. 
You need enough RF stored in the Laser Amplifier (~800mil RF or more). 
You need to produce Deterium and Tritium as fuel for the Reactor. 
You need a Hohlraum with D-T Fuel in the Controller. 
The next step, is to go into the Controller, go to Fuel and set the Injection Rate to 2. 
After that, you activate the Laser Amplifier (by setting redstone mode from "High" to "Low", or giving it a redstone signal) to shoot into the Laser Matrix Focus, which should cause the ignition. 
If it didn't, you have to store up RF again and possibly place a new Hohlraum in the Controller.

This is the ultimate Reactor for Mekanism, that has a minimum generation of 200.000 rf/t. 
It's quite complicated to get starting, so the explanation will be split between the connected quests of the Fusion Reactor. 
This quest will explain the structure of the Fusion Reactor. 
The base is going to be a 3x3 of Reactor Casing, with 1 additional Casing at N, S, E and W (13 blocks total). 
The 2nd layer will form a 5x5 square without corners on top (12 blocks total). 
The 3rd layer will a 5x5 square With corners. One of the middle blocks has to be the Laser Focus Matrix, side doesn't matter (16 blocks total). 
The 4th layer is exactly like the 2nd (12 blocks total). 
The 5th layer is like the first layer, except the Reactor Controller needs to be in the middle (13 blocks total). 
If the structure is correct, the Controller will light up. 
On each side, the middle 5 blocks (shaped like a +, or in other words, all the edge blocks needs to be Reactor Casing) can be exchanged for either Reactor Glass (to look inside), or Reactor Ports. You will need at least 3 Reactor Ports in total. 2 for Fuel Input, 1 for Power Output. 
The only blocks that can't be replaced for Reactor Glass or Reactor Ports is the Controller and Laser Focus Matrix that needs a central spot.

Things are starting to heat up. 
Fuelwood Heater creates heat by burning fuel, and Resistive Heater converts Energy into Heat. 
Heat can be transfered with Thermodynamic Conductors. 
Heat can be applied to the Thermoelectric Boiler, and the Thermal Evaporation Plant (requires Vavle input)
betterquesting:10.name:8: Just me, or is it hot in here?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Sulfur can be hard to get your hands on from mining. Luckily there are ways to produce it all the way from Cobblestone (which is pretty easy to get your hands on). 
This is a 4 machine setup. 
Cobblestone goes into a Crusher, which outputs Gravel. 
Gravel goes a Purification Chamber with Oxygen to produce 1:1 Flint. 
Flint goes into a Crusher to make it into Gunpowder. 
Gunpowder goes into a Chemical Injection Chamber with Hydrogen Chloride to output Sulfur Dust. 
The Sulfur Dust then goes into the Chemical Oxydizer for the Quintuple Ore Processing.

While Lithium Dust isn't needed for a lot, what it's needed for, will require a lot. 
The amount of Induction Cells needed for a full 18x18x18 is no joke, so you better get stocking. 
Just pump some Liquid Lithium into the Crystallizer, and get the dust.

While the Rotary Condensentrator can turn gasses into liquids and back, it can also turn Water into a gassous form, in terms of Water Vapor. 
This is needed for the Quintuple Ore Processing

The Atomic Disassembler is the ultimate all-in-one tool, so it counts as Pickaxe, Axe, Shovel, Hoe and Sword (20 hearts). It uses RF instead of durability, but each broken block/attack uses RF. 
If it runs out of RF, it will mine slower than a Wooden Pickaxe, its Vein mode ceases to work and only does 4 hearts. 
It has 5 modes, that can be switched between by Shift Right-Clicking. Fast, Normal, Slow, Vein, Off. 
Fast Mode is the same speed as a Diamond Pick with Efficiency V and Haste II. 
Normal Mode is like a Diamond Pick, with Efficiency V
Slow Mode is like a Diamond Pick, unenchanted. 
The Vein mode, takes all the blocks of that type touching the one you mined - Only works on Ores and Wood Logs. It can not be used to clear out Stone and the like. 
The Off mode, disables all its tool abilities, making it unable to break blocks, and turns it into a Sword. 
The Atomic Disassembler tills dirt AND grass in a 1x1 on Slow/Off, 3x3 on Normal/Vein and 5x5 on Fast. It can not make Grass Paths. 
The Atomic Disassembler can not be enchanted.

The Heavy Water has to be pumped into a Electrolytical Separator. This will give you Oxygen and Deterium. 
Deterium is what you need for the Fusion Reactor. Deterium should be pumped directly into the Reactor

The Fusion Reactor needs 2 kinds of fuel, and Deterium is one of them. 
First you need to make Heavy Water. The Heavy Water comes from the Electric Pump, with a Filter Upgrade. 
While the Electric Pump fully upgraded pumps really fast, while filtering it goes a lot slower. 
A single pump, fully upgraded with a Filter, pumps max 10mb/t

Time to one-up your ore processing, to x4. 
Put the ores in a Chemical Injection Chamber, and add Hydrogen Chloride to it, and then send it on through the x3 processing setup. 
Your total machine setup should now be Chemical Injection Chamber -> Purification Chamber -> Crusher -> Enrichment Chamber -> Smelter
betterquesting:10.name:8: Why a tripple, when you can get a Quad?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Plastic blocks are aesthetic blocks with a Very flat color. 
You are going to need another Pressurized Reaction Chamber for its second function, Oxygen, Substrate and Liquid Ethylene which we covered the last couple of quests. 
The Substrate will turn into HDPE Pellets. which can be turned into HDPE Sheets, which can be turned into Plastic Blocks. 
Making HDPE Pellets will give Oxygen as a side product, which can be reused. It just has to be piped out and back in. 
A note to make, is that a Biofuel -> Substrate will create more Ethylene than a Substrate -> HDPE Pellet requires, so you will have leftover, which you can use in a Gas-Burning Generator.
Another tier, another upgrade for your wires and pipes! This is the last upgrade for wires and pipes.

Before the Reactor can start up and produce power, it needs a kickstart injection of D-T Fuel, which is done through the Hohlraum with D-T Fuel in it. 
To get D-T Fuel into it, place it in the [+], in either the Chemical Infuser or a Gas Tank with D-T Fuel.

When you have your Liquid Lithium, you have to convert it into gas with the Rotary Condensentrator, and then transfer the Lithium gas into a Solar Neutron Activator to get Tritium. 
The Solar Neutron Activator does require HDPE Sheets to make, so you should probably look into the Plastic quest if you haven't done so yet. 
The Solar Neutron Activate takes IN gas from the Bottom, and outputs at the front. 
The Solar Neutron Activator needs Sunlight to process the Lithium. Transparent blocks like glass can be put above it. 
Tritium should be pumped directly into the Reactor.
betterquesting:10.name:8: By the Power of the sun!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Gas-Burning Generators does as the name implies, generate power from burning gas. 
It can burn Hydrogen and Ethylene for power generation only. 
Burning Hydrogen gives you no power gain at all in Mekanism V9, and will give you exactly the same amount of power back, that you used to create that Hydrogen.
Burning Ethylene though, is very much worth it, and a really good mid-game source of power, given you have plenty of materials to turn into Bio Fuel

[This quest chain focuses on power production] 
Pressurized Reaction Chamber is used to create Ethylene, Substrate and HDPE Pellets from Biofuel. 
Its first function is creating Substrate from Biofuel, Hydrogen and Water, with Ethylene (gas) as a side product. 
You may want to configure the in/output sides on the PRC. 
The Ethylene is going to be used in the following quest. 
The Substrate is going to be a waste product here.

The laser is both your first and last step towards the Fusion Reactor. 
The Reactor needs a burst of heat, before it can kickstart, and the lasers allows that by firing RF into it. 
There's 2 blocks, the Laser and the Laser Amplifier. 
The Lasers shoots a laser, and the Laser Amplifiers combines these lasers into one big beam. 
You can focus Amplifiers into more Amplifiers. 
You want your final Amplifier to line up with the Laser Focus Matrix of the Fusion Reactor. 
You want at least 800mil RF in the final Amplifier to do the kickstart in one big burst (set the Amplifiers redstone mode to "High"), and each Laser only transfers 2000 RF/t, so it can be quite a slow process if you don't have a lot of Lasers. 

WARNING: The Lasers will break blocks and damage mobs/players, and the stronger the laser is, the faster it breaks/more damage it deals. They will not break any Laser Focus Matrixes. The Laser reaches for 64 blocks, and can extended with Amplifiers.

D-T Fuel is what is needed to do the Kickstart in the Reactor. 
§cNow, DO NOT PUMP D-T FUEL DIRECTLY INTO THE REACTOR, §runless you can keep up with its demand (1000mb/t), which does result in 100mil rf/t generated. 
The Fusion Reactor will make its own D-T Fuel, and take depending on your Injection Rate (minimum 2). 
To make the D-T Fuel, you have to put Deterium and Tritium into a Chemical Infuser. The only use for the D-T Fuel is to fill up the Hohlraums (unless you pump directly into the Reactor).

The Robit is a companion that can follow you around. You have to place it down on a Charge Pad, which will act as its home. 
The Robit can providing all kinds of services. 
It can pick up blocks you drop, and put it in its inventory, which also can act as a chest. 
It can provide Crafting Table, Furnance (requires fuel) and Anvil features as well. 
The robit loses energy when it takes damage. Should it run out of energy, either from damage or usage, it will automatically teleport back home. 
You can of course also tell it yourself to teleport back home. And of course you can rename it too. 
To pick it up again, Shift-Right Click it with a Configurator. After being picked up, you can set a new home to it on a different Charged Pad if you desire.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Pet on a leash - without the leash

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Osmium Compresser combines Osmium Ingots and Refined Obsidian Dust or Glowstone Dust to make Refined Obsidian Ingots or Glowstone Ingots. 
NOTE: The Refined Obsidian armor is really durable, and offers a lot of protection.

The Thermoelectric Boiler multistructure that creates Steam from Water and Heat. 
The structure requirements is seen in the Crafting Task. The minimum size for a Boiler is 3x3x4, but with the crafting and reward, there is exactly enough for a 4x4x9. 
The base and edges has to be Boiler Casing. The walls has to be Boiler Casing, Boiler Valve or Structural Glass. 
The inside of the Boiler is split into 2 parts: Water storage (Bottom part) and Steam storage (Upper part). The Water storage is where the Superheating Elements will go. They don't have be in any particular shape, aslong as they are connected. The more Superheating Elements you have, the faster it can produce Steam. 
The top part has to be separated with Pressure Dispersers (full layer), which is where the steam is stored and extracted. The Water input Valve, has to be below the Pressure Dispersers, while the Steam output has to be on level or above the Pressure Dispersers (while still on the wall)

Elite Factories are the last step. 
They have 7 Processing Slots, and like the rest, they use energy based on the amount of operations running.Elite is the last tier of Factories. 
Like the previous Factory quests, crafting any Elite Factory will do, despite the Crafting Task saying "Elite Smeling Factory". 
Note: The Ultimate Tier Installer can only be used on Fluid and Gas tanks.

The Fusion Reactor can also be used to produce Steam. 
The only thing required is an additional 2 Reactor Ports, and to set the Injection Rate to 4 or more. 
One of the Ports is for Water Input, and the other is for Steam Output. 
Simply pumping Water into the Reactor will make it start producing Steam at upto 150.000mb/t. 
The Water:Steam ratio is 1:1. 
It is important to use the Configurator on the Steam Reactor Port to set it to Output. It will still produce half the RF while producing Steam. 

NOTE: You may want to put the Reactor Port (Output) directly next to the Steam Input of your Turbine (so no pipes between), unless you have a pipe with unlimited Pump Rate.
betterquesting:10.name:8: More Steam than you could ever need

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
[Multiplayer Only] 
This block is used to control the security of your machines. Every machine with an Interface has Security settings. Public, Private and Trusted. 
On Public, anyone can access it. 
On Private, only you can access it. 
On Trusted, only persons that you put on the Trusted List can access it. The Trusted List is in the Security Desk, and is the only place to add/remove people from the list. 
The Security Desk has 3 security settings at the bottom, and machines put in the bottom right slot, will have that setting applied to them. 
To unlock a machine you own, put it in the top right slot. 
The "Security Overwrite" will set all the machines you own, to the selected Security setting in the Security Desk. Very handy if you have some people sneaking around with your machines!

The Turbine is one of Mekanisms bigger power generators. It is a Multiblock, that runs on Steam.
It is a multistructure that can be turned and flipped in any direction, but in the explanation we're going to have it standing, with the Steam at the top, and the blades going down. 
The materials from the Crafting Task is enough for a 5x5x6. Like the other Mekanism multistructures, the edges must be the base block (Turbine Casing in this case). 
On the top part, you want Turbine Vents. These can be on level or above the Rotational Complex. 
On the top level inside the Turbine, you have to place your Electromagnetic Coils. These just have to connect to each other and the Rotational Complex. 
Below those you need your Pressure Dispersers. Like the Boiler, these must cover the entire layer out to the walls. 
In the middle of the Pressure Dispersers, you want to place your Rotational Complex. 
From the Rotational Complex to the bottom, you place the Turbine Rotors, and the put your Turbine Blades on the Rotors. 
The Valves can go anywhere on the walls (except the corners). The Valves is both Steam input and Power Output. 
The power output from the turbine, depends on the amount of Steam coming in to the turbine. More steam = more power.
 In the Statistics window you can see what is currently limiting your power generation (in the case of the 5x5x6, it's the amount of blades). The fix to this is to build it taller.

Works like the previous factory, but now with 5 slots instead of 3. 
Once again, the energy used goes up, per operation going. 
Like the previous Factory quest, crafting any Advanced Factory will do, despite the Crafting Task saying "Advanced Smelting Factory". 

Note: The Advanced Tier Installer and higher can also be used on Fluid and Gas Tanks to increase their capacity

The Induction Matrix is a multiblock power storage. 
There is not much to the construction of the Induction Matrix, other than it has to be a box, with a minimum size of 3x3x4 and maximum size of 18x18x18. Just include some Induction Ports to take power in and out. 
As with all other Mekanism multistructures, the corners has to be built of the base block (in this case Induction Casing), and the walls can be of Structural Glass. 
The amount of stored in the Induction Matrix depends on the Induction Cells inside of it, with each Induction Cell holding a certain amount. The Induction Providers determines how much power can go in and out of the Induction Matrix. 
The Crafting Task has materials for a 4x4x4 box. The Matrix does NOT have to fully filled to function. It is a "functional" structure while empty, except it can hold 0 RF and transfer 0 RF/t

Chemical Infuser infuses 2 gasses together to create a 3rd one. 
Inputs are on the sides (Chemical Infuser has no side specific inputs for any recipe), output is in the front. 
To make Hydrogen Chloride, you need Hydrogen from an Electrolytical Separator with Water, and Chloride from an Eletrolytical Separator with Brine.

NOTE: Putting Brine in a Eletrolytical Separator will also produce Sodium, which currently has no use, so don't worry about storing it.

While the peasantry does their hardest, sometimes one would like a farm or device to be powered at night when these noble creatures sleep.

After consulting with your new kingdoms top engineers, you have come up with a few ways to produce a unique form of energy called "torque". Connecting a torque generator with one of your farms will supply it with power. Maybe this will usher in a new age of prosperity!

Windmill controllers are attached to windmill blades (requiring a lot of wool and a configuration of at least 5x5 blades.

Watermills will automatically make use of any flowing water behind them (rotate them with your hammer). You may also use falling water for even more energy.

Hand cranked generators allow both you (switch your hammer into work mode) and your peasants to supply energy manually. This is handy for initial testing, beefing up energy reserves, and in case of emergency power outages.

Before you begin thinking about using machinery, first you need a proper tool.

A hammer has 2 modes which can be switched in between. 

In "rotate" mode the right click will rotate appropriate blocks depending on the surface you used it on.

In "work" mode right clicking will use an block. The most noteable use of this is cranking a hand-cranked generator manually.

Torque is transferred through torque "shafts", one-directional rotating lines of power.

These shafts come in 3 tiers, each tier with its own maximum energy capacity and loss of energy over distance. This is important to note, as the earliest tier is ill-suited for connections that are overly long.

To go around corners, torque junktions are needed. To split input torque into multiple outputs, distributors should be employed.

It can be quite tricky to find out which side connects to what. Use your hammer in rotation mode until you see a connection being made.

As a general rule, shafts have 1 input and 1 output. Junktions have 5 inputs and 1 output. Distributors have 1 input and 5 outputs.


Torque shafts are compatible with universal cables for power conversion.
You're going to need a willing villager in order to complete the next quest. Good luck!

Flywheels are a way to store torque from your generators, thought up by your ingenous engineers.

A flywheel controller has an input and an output side, allowing you to use it as an "in-between" battery. This is important because all torque power connections are one-directional.

Once you place a flywheel controller, you may place flywheel storages underneath it. This is a massive rotating mass aimed to preserve the excess energy not currently needed. Waste not, want not!

Sometimes a subject is unable to determin how to best do its work for the kingdom.

This is when you as august king should step in and deliver them with a work order. A work order will tell a worker NPC where to work, and in which order to frequent the work stations and farms. The default key for marking a location is Z, and via right-click you can further modify the order.

Simply put the order into your subjects inventory afterwards and they should stop looking for work on their own and only work at their designated targets.

Much as the work order is to your workers, the combat order will tell a combat NPC where to go.

You can either set your soldiers as sentries, with a single post that they will only leave to eat, or as a patrol route, where they will frequent the first point after reaching the last.

One of the most important NPCs in your kingdom is the courier.

Couriers are workers that you equip with backpacks and a routing order. They will be able to transfer items from inventory to inventory according to your specifications in the order. A very basic use of them is to have them supply and empty chests and furnaces.

A courier can be used to automize food distribution for your kingdom, by having him empty farms and deliver food to the upkeep points.

Would it not be fantastic if your peasantry kept working while you were away tending to the faraway needs of your realm?

Well fret no more, for the chunk loader is just what you are looking for. 

Available as either a block (the simple one loads a 3x3 chunk radius) or as a farm upgrade (loading the farm block chunk and all the chunks inside the farms bounds), you may engage in diplomatic retreats at your leisure, knowing that in your far away home, your workers are busy as ever.

Mailboxes are fast ways to transfer items over distances wirelessly.

Simply name the mailbox appropriatly, give it the name of another mail box and enjoy reasonably fast wireless transfer of items.


Great to keep in touch with distant relatives until the telephone is invented!

You have done it my liege!

The kingdom is large and prosperous, and the bounty of the land is being brought in by hands too many to count. But who is to oversee all of these riches? Chests soon run full, inventories and backpacks offering little respite. And who shall sort all of this in a way where you can find what you need in time?

Your brightest scientists have come up with a solution.

The warehous is an inventory management system. Much like your farms, it has maximum bounds, which you can fill with storage units. Every unit improves how many items can ultimately be stored in it. BE CAREFUL NOT TO BREAK A FULL STORAGE. The storage capacity of these units is far beyond any diamond chest. Breaking a full one might plunge your world into chaos.

You yourself can interact with the warehouse interface and look for item simply by name, quickly filtering through hundrets of thousands of items, given an adequate warehouse.

Many warehouse operations require a supply of power. Make sure to adequatly supply it.

The warehouse interface is how the common people interact with your warehouse.

While appearing complex at first, it is quite easy my liege. While inside a warehouses bounds, it can access all of the warehouses items.

The interface has its own internal 9 space storage. If anything is put into there that is not currently a filter, the warehouse will automatically sort it into a storage unit.

If the block has a filter, the warehouse will automatically fill the interfaces inventory with the desired number of items. This means that your loyal couriers can put in any material they recover, or take out anything you set up as a filter for the interface (and of course, their routing order).

Your mills only work if the area they're in is loaded, and that won't always be the case. Because of that, you're going to need a Chunk Loading Ward. Simply place it near your mills, preferably within 16 blocks of them.

Even with the added functionalities of the warehouse, it takes time to find the right items for the right recipes every time.

Your royal treasurer Jei has worked with your engineers to come up with an ingenious solution.

The warehouse crafting station, placed ontop of the controller, considers all items inside the warehouse as in your inventory for crafting purposes. This means that working with "Just Enough Items", you can simply use the craft button ("+" Button) on recipes in order to have the station draw the materials nessessary from your storages. Even mass production is possible like this.

While it takes a moment to get used to, it is well worth the effort my liege, as it will tremendously improve your crafting experience. I give you my word!

The Solar Panel Controller is the main block of the Solar Array multi-block structure, which will generate a good amount of power just by taking in sunlight. If you add Piezo Modifiers to it, it will also generate power when it rains.
The resource miner is a multi-block machine that, when given power, mines materials from the void. The controller needs to be above void, or have bedrock under it to work.
The ore miner is a multi-block machine that, when given power, mines ores from the void. The controller needs to be above void, or have bedrock under it to work.
The Digital Guide contains everything you need to know about Environmental Tech.Have the Digital Guide [WIP] in your inventory.

§lME Pattern Terminals§r are used to program §lCrafting Patterns§r and §lProcessing Patterns§r, the former being used by §lMolecular Assemblers§r to perform crafting table recipes, and the latter being used to perform recipes done by other blocks and machines (including furnaces and brewing stands, but mainly machines from other mods).

  The Terminal's GUI is broken up into three parts:

 * The §l§oME Grid§r at the top to allow access to ingredients for recipes,

 * The §l§oPattern Grid§r group in the lower left and middle is where you'll be setting therecipes for patterns, and

 * The §l§oPattern Queue§r group in the lower right is where you'll put patterns to be programmed and where you'll retrieved patterns that have been programmed.

  Instructions to program the two types of patterns are covered later in the questline.

The §l§oCrafting Processing Unit§r is a multiblock construction that is essential to AE2's autocrafting.  In essence, it is responsible for coordinating the various machines connected to the ME system so that they can craft one or more items from a single request.

  They are constructed in a solid cuboid, in any arrangement, of its component blocks.

  §lCrafting Units§r are a core crafting ingredient for the other component blocks of the Crafting CPU multiblock.  They can used as filler blocks, too, but otherwise don't have any function.

The Botanical Brewery allows you to craft Brews using Mana and other ingredients.

Items can be inserted into the Brewery by either right clicking on them with the item in hand or by tossing them at it. First, a Vial needs to be put in order to receive the Brew, then the various ingredients can be added.

Once a valid recipe is formed (check the Lexica Botania and/or Just Enough Items), the Brewery will start accepting Mana from Mana Spreaders. Once enough Mana is supplied, the Brew will be crafted, consuming the ingredients in the process.

Vials contain multiple charges of a Brew, unlike vanilla Potions which can only be drank once.

The Crystal Binder is used to connect the Crystals to each other.
Shift-Right Click a crystal with the Crystal Binder to select it, and Right Click on another crystal to link it.

The Crystals will always equalize all their energy between them

Welcome to Tinkers' Construct!

These quests will help you to learn the ropes of this mod and be able to create your own customizable weapons and tools. Let's start out with the most important basic tool.

The manual.

 Craft the§l 'M§laterials and You'§0 m§0anual. Once you have it, the book willgive you information needed to know how to create most of the things of this mod.

Next we need some §l'Patterns§0§l'§0. Craft some of those up and we can move on to the next step.
Welcome to RFTools! This mod is filled with gadgets that can make your Minecrafting experience a whole lot better, such as teleporters, storage, the Builder, and highly advanced redstone.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the RFTools questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Alright, so we have the table that will help us make the necessary patterns. Before you can just go off and make a bunch of patterns, let us take this step by step.

One of the most important tools in the miner's arsenal: the pickaxe. Let's make that §l'pickaxe head pattern§0§l'§0. 

Just right click on the table and put some of those blank patterns you made earlier in the stencil slot and select the pickaxe head. Then take the resulting pattern and voila! We're on our way to getting you your first Tinker's Pickaxe. :)

This one is a simple one. In order to make those fancy tools and weapons you're eyeing, we need a §l'stencil table'§0, so lets go ahead and make that. Then we can move on to the next step.

To build it, you just need to have one wooden plank of any kind of wood and a §l'Blank Pattern'§0 on top of the planks in a crafting grid.

The §lQuartz Wrench§r is used to safely pry off most AE2 devices and cables, and can interact with some devices (such as the ME Interface) in a special way.  To pry off a device or cable, Sneak + Use the wrench while looking at the target.  Careful! Sometimes they can fly off a fair distance.

Note: There's no difference between the Certus and Nether Quartz wrenches in terms of functionality.

  The §lNetwork Tool§r is a modified Quartz Wrench that can open a GUI on a cable or connected device to view the status of all connected cables/devices on the network, right up to the ME Controller.  It however loses some of the special functions that a Quartz Wrench has.

The §lCharged Staff§r is a weapon that deals damage comparable to that of an Iron Sword.  It differs from the sword, however, in that it consumes energy instead of durability.  It also deals magic damage instead of physical, which means it can bypass most armors.  A notable exception are Witches, who have a bit of magic resistance instead of armor.

  The §lEntropy Manipulator§r can set fires to blocks and mobs at the cost of energy.  Right click on a block, left click on a mob.

  Both devices may be recharged in a §lCharger§r.

§lCrafting Monitors§r are an optional block that will visually display the current top-level task (what you ordered).

 Only one of these may be in the entire multiblock.
betterquesting:10.name:8: I See What You Did There...

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§lCrafting Storage Units§r are like the RAM of your computer, allowing for larger recipes or larger batch orders to go through.  Shouuld there be an insufficent amount of CSU's in the multiblock, the crafting request will refuse to start.  Should this happen, you can either reduce the number of requested items in the batch, add more CSU's to the multiblock, or swap out CSU's with a higher tier version.

  You must have at least one CSU in the multiblock.

§lCrafting Co-Processing Units§r are the task coordinators of the multiblock.  A task is defined as a single crafting operation, and each Unit can initiate a single task by moving the requested ingredients to the appropriate ME Interface.  More CCPU's in the multiblock mean more tasks can be started at the same time, although a single CCPU is still capable of doing different types of tasks.

  For example, 4 assemblers are attached to an ME interface.  All 4 assemblers have the potential of performing the same type of crafting task.  With a single CCPU, 1 assembler will be started, then another, then another, then finally the last assembler.  With 4 CCPU's, all 4 assemblers will be started at the same time.  For small crafting recipes, the difference usually doesn't matter since the CCPU's can switch between tasks at a fast rate.  Only on the very large recipes does adding more CCPU's make an impact.

The §lMolecular Assembler§r is a machine that will perform a craft according to a §lCrafting Pattern§r placed in the slot above the output slot.  Items piped into the Assembler will go to the correct location and the result will be automatically pushed into an adjacent inventory.  Crafting performed in this matter is referred to as §opassive§r or §ocontinous auto-crafting§r, since crafting will continously be done so long as the Assembler is fed enough ingredients.

Tip:  When trying to push the result, the §lAssembler§r will start with the bottom, then the top, then the sides.  Keep this in mind when doing passive auto-crafting, as it can push into its input hopper.

  The §lAssembler§r must be powered through a cable or another connected AE2, but it does not take up a channel.

This is it, the culmination of several hours of reading walls of text that could keep out the Mongols during all of the Ming Dynasty.

  Everything learned thus far is put to use to achieve §o§lon-demand auto-crafting§r. We will start of with crafting table recipes before moving on to the slightly more complex machine crafting.

  First of all, make sure you have a functioning §lCrafting Processing Unit§r multiblock connected to the ME system (including an ME drive with at least one Storage Cell in it), and sufficient power for everything.

  Place a §lME Interface§r somewhere and  connect it to the rest of the ME system.

  Then, place a §lMolecular Assembler§r on top or otherwise adjacent to the interface.

  Program a §lCrafting Pattern§r for §lWood Planks§r (or another simple crafting recipe) and place the pattern in a slot in the bottom row of the §lInterface§r's GUI.

  Finally, §o§lTest§r the installation by interacting with any suitable §lME Terminal§r or variant.  The item you programmed the Pattern to (such as our wood planks) should show up in the grid with a friendly "CRAFT" label over it.

Tip:  If you already have wood planks in the system, you should pull them all out or use a different recipe.

Tip:  If the programmed item still doesn't show up in the grid, check your connections, and check to see you programmed the Pattern correctly.  Too often does a Processing Pattern get made instead of the inteded Crafting Pattern.

  Left click on the item, the crafting request GUI should pop up, allowing you to specify how many items to craft.  We'll just go with 1 for this test.

  The next GUI that pops up will show you how many bytes is required to process the "job," and all of the ingredients available and any ingredients that need to be crafted.  Click "START" to tell the system to begin crafting!

Note: If if an error message pops up stating that "No processors are available!" it probably means you need more Crafting Storage Units.

§lCrafting Patterns§r are relatively straight forward to program.

  First, ensure that the button on the right hand side looks like a crafting table, if it does not, then press it to switch it over.

  Place the ingredients in the §l§oPattern Grid§r like you would a normal crafting grid, and the resulting item should appear in the slot to the immediate right.  (If it doesn't, check your recipe).

  Then, make sure you have at least one §lBlank Pattern§r in the top slot of the §l§oPattern Queue§r and press the button with a down arrow to program it.

Tip:  You'd normally would want the ore dictionary enabled for patterns, unless there's a specific reason why one type of copper (for example) is extra special.

Tip:  Patterns can be overwritten if left in the bottom slot of the §l§oPattern Queue§r

§lProcessing Patterns§r are programmed in a similar fashion to §lCrafting Patterns§r with a few key differences.

  First of which is that the order of the items in the §l§oPattern Grid§r no longer matter, these will all be pushed to a recipient machine (or inventory!) at the same time.

  Second of which is that you can specify up to three different result (or output) items on the right side of the §l§oPattern Grid§r.  These are items that the ME system will expect to find after some time, and must be pushed into the network by hoppers or pipes via §lME Interfaces§r, or be pulled in by an §lImport Bus§r.

  Lastly, you can specify a different amount of items (up to a full stack) per slot in either the input or output sides of the §l§oPattern Grid

§4§l§oWarning!§r A crafting task will look for §oexactly§r the same amount of items you specified in the output slots of the Pattern Grid.  If it cannot find the item (for example Thermal Foundation's §lSlag§r) then the crafting task will be listed as incomplete or still "in-progress."  You'll have to be clever to get such items to autocraft correctly.§r..

Aside from §lME Interfaces§r, there are also §lImport Busses§r and §lExport Busses§r.

  Both types should be fairly self-explanitory:

 The §lImport Bus§r pulls items from an attached inventory or machine §ointo§r the ME System.  It can be configured to pull only a certain type of item through its GUI.

 The §lExport Bus§r pushes items into an inventory or machine that it is attached to.  It must be told which items to export and how many it should try to push at a time (similar to how the ME Interface operates).

  Both Busses start off with only 1 available slot, but you can give them up to 2 §lCapacity Cards§r to increase by 4 slots each for each card.

  Both Busses are multipart constructions, and are easily installed by placing them on the inventory/machine that they will be importing/exporting.

By now, you should have successfully made §lWood Planks§r from demanding it through an §lME Terminal§r.  If not, check your connections (A §lNetwork Tool§r may help), check your power supply, and check your §lCrafting Pattern§r for any flaws.

This final quest in the autocrafting line will teach you the basics of interfacing machines to get them to do autocrafting for you.  For our example, we'll automate the §lInscriber§r, which is a good machine to automate since you will be needing quite a few of the different processors as you progress further through AE2.

  You will need:
1x §lME Interface§r
1x §lImport Bus§r
1x §lInscriber§r
1x §lInscriber Silicon Press§r
1x §lBlank Pattern§r

  Place the §lInscriber§r.

  Place the §lME Interface§r on top of the Inscriber (or anywhere adjacent).

  Place the §lImport Bus§r on the bottom of the Inscriber (or anywhere adjacent).  

  Connect the §lME Interface§r and the §lImport Bus§r to the ME system.

  Place the §lInscriber Silicon Press§r inside of the Inscriber, and place a piece of Silicon in the center slot to verify that it has power and is functioning.

Hint: The panel variant of the ME Interface won't supply power, so you may have to attach a cable to the side of the Inscriber.

  Program a §lProcessing Pattern§r (remember, it has a Furnace icon) on the ME Pattern Terminal.  1 Silicon as the input, 1 Printed Silicon as the Output.

  Place the programmed Processing Pattern into the §lME Interface§r, and §l§oTest§r the setup by requesting a Printed Silicon from the ME System (Like you did with the previous quest).

That's it.  That's the basics to automating a machine with AE2.  The following are tips, hints, and a general summary of what happens.

§l  Crafting Patterns§r or §lProcessing Patterns§r go into the §lME Interfaces§r, when a crafting request is made by the §l§oCPU multiblock§r, it'll have the ME Interface push the ingredients into an adjacent inventory.

Tip:  If you're one for compact builds, you can right click an §lME Interface§r block with a §lQuartz Wrench§r to tell it to push only into a certain direction.  Otherwise, the Interface will pick a side at random.  You can also use the panel version of the Interface to limit to just one side, but remember that it won't supply power nor act as a cable.

  Use §lImport Busses§r to pull crafted items from machines into the ME system. If the machine can push items, you can instead have it push into an ME Interface (which can be the same one that has the Processing Pattern).

  Machines that need a Catalyst, Tool, or Fuel (such as furnaces) should have that item pushed into them by an §lExport Bus§r, have the tool left in them, or be maintained by other means.  Some blocks, such as furnaces, are picky about which side the items are pushed in and taken.  Furnaces have input at the top, fuel at any side, and output at the bottom.

  Crafting tasks are marked as "success" if the product of a Crafting Pattern or Processing Pattern is pushed into the system from §oany§r ME Interface or Import Bus.  This only happens if the task was started by a CPU, however.

The Portable Cell is AE2's version of a backpack, offering a much larger portable storage solution than most backpacks, bags, etc. available from other mods.  The only downside is that you have to recharge it occasionally.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Just a Few for the Road

betterquesting:10.desc:8: There may be some cases where you would prefer to use another storage method outside of the ME system, such as Storage Drawers.  For those cases there is the §lStorage Bus§r.  Attach this onto the inventory system where both input and output operations can occur (such as on a Drawer Controller).

The §lAnnihilation Plane§r will instantly mine any block that is in front of it and import its broken products into the ME system.  This might be useful for vanilla cobble generators and similar constructions.

  The §lFormation Plane§r will instantly place configured blocks or items in the space in front it, whenever an Annihalation Plane was activated.  You also have the option of dropping blocks as items instead of placing them in the world.

  The pair might be useful for some uncommon or rare block drops, such as flint from gravel.  In such a setup you'd place a Formation plane two blocks above an Annihilation Plane and have the gravel blocks fall down into the Annihlation Plane.

§4§l§oWarning:§r This can easily become a lag machine if you are not careful!

  The §lIdentity Annihilation Plane§r will instantly mine a block as if it had the silk touch enchantment.

§l Wireless Terminals§r and §lWireless Crafting Terminals §rallow you to access your ME system without needing to stand by an ME Terminal that's anchored down to a cable somewhere.

  In order to do this, however, they need to be within range of a §lWireless Access Point§r, which start off with about an 16 block range.  This range can be improved up to 512m from the access point by installing §lWireless Boosters§r, this comes at the cost of more power, however.

  They also need to be linked to the ME System, and the only way to do this is through the §lSecurity Terminal§r.

  Lastly, they consume energy for the entire duration you have its GUI open. It doesn't consume energy per request, however.
