The §lSecurity Terminal§r is used in conjuction with §lBiometric Cards§r to control who all has access to your ME system.  By default, everyone has access, which might not be desirable on a PvP server or if your ME terminals are in a somewhat vulnerable spot.

  The §lSecurity Terminal §ronly provides network access control; blocks can still be broken. You'll need something else to protect against vandalism (in particular your §lME Drives§r, which are usually the most valuable device).

  The player who put down the Terminal is recognized as the §l§oNetwork Admin§r, and has irrevocable full rights access.  Which is a good thing, because the only way to regain access is from another player who has security clearance, or to break the Terminal.

  The Terminal's GUI at the bottom should be mostly self explananitory.  §lBiometric Cards§r go in the left hand slot, and the buttons to the permit or forbid certain actions.  Biometric Cards may be set to a particular player by giving it to them and having the player sneak right-click with the card in hand.  An empty Card allows setting the permissions for all players who don't have a Card set to them.  Cards do not need to be kept by the players, but they do need to exist somewhere.

  The two slots on the right-most side of the Terminal's GUI are for linking §lWireless Terminals§r, Just place one in the top slot and it will be linked to the ME system the Desk is connected to.

§lMemory Cards§r are used to copy the configuration of ME Interfaces and Busses and then paste them onto the same type of device.  This may be useful if you have several Interfaces or Busses with the same configuration.

  They may be also used to link P2P Tunnels.

Items stored on the Cells are composed of an 8 byte (B) type tag, and a 1 byte quantity tag for every 8 items take.  Items that normally don't stack, such as tools and armor, will stack within the Cell so long as they have exact same damage data and NBT data (enchantments).

  For example, 8 identical iron swords will only take up 9B (1 type tag for 8B, 1 quantity tag for 1B).  However, if one of the swords is damaged or is enchanted, the memory cost jumps up to 18B (2 type tags for 16B, 2 quantity tags for 2B).

  You can partition a Storage Cell at a §lCell Workbench§r to limit the types of items that can be stored on the cell.  This will ensure that the majority of the available memory space will be used by quantity tags instead of the more bulky type tags, which can be useful when trying to micromanage multiple Storage Cells installed in the ME system.

  Partitioned Storage Cells have a higher priority than standard Storage Cells, so they will get filled up first by the ME system before the "misc. storage"  ones will.

  The grid in the GUI of the §lCell Workbench§r is where you set the filters/partitions.  The slot in the upper right of the GUI is where you place the Storage Cell that you'll be working on.  The buttons on the left do verious things, and it is recommended that you experiment with them to see what they do.

The §lCharged Quartz Fixture§r is a somewhat nice looking light source that can be placed on solid blocks from any side.

  The §lLight Detecting Fixture§r operates similarly to that of the vanilla Daylight Detector, but can be placed on solid blocks from any side.  It emits a redstone signal to all adjacent block spaces, but not to the block it is attached to.
The Awkward Potion is the base of most potions.
Start your own brewery by crafting a Brewing Stand.
Turn in one of each tier 1 vanilla potion that buffs the player.
Get 10 Glowstone Dust and 10 Redstone Dust.
Give 2 blocks of: Iron, Gold & Diamond in exchange for money.
Find a music disc, and find or craft a Jukebox. Music discs can be found in dungeon chests, and are also dropped by creepers killed by skeletons.
Find one of each vanilla sapling.
Find one of each small vanilla flower.
Find one of each large vanilla flower.

The Ancient Codex is this mod's in game manual, containing useful information about everything you need to know about Embers.

Both materials required to craft this item can be found by slaying Ancient Golems which spawn at night. Be mindful though, as they can hurt quite a bit.

Even though this quest line will assume for the most part you haven't read the Codex, we strongly encourage you to check it on your own to learn more about specific topics that aren't covered here.

The Atmospheric Gauge, while not technically required, is a tool that is highly recommended to use before starting Embers.

Holding it in your hand will display a rough indicator of the level of Ember near the current position (ignoring the vertical axis). It is highly recommended to find an area with a high density of it to set up the Ember Bore in (see the Ember Bore quest), as this will very noticeably increase the speed at which you can progress through the mod.

The Ember Bore is a big machine that is used to collect Ember from Bedrock.

After finding a place with a good enough amount of Ember (see Atmospheric Gauge quest), you'll need to dig to Bedrock and place the Bore so that its blade touch it. The Machine itself is 3x3x3, with the blades not actually being solid and making up the bottom 2 layers of the structure.

Once placed, you can put a Mechanical Core on top of it to extend its only interactable side (the one with a little hole) so that you can plug more than one machine/cable on it.

Finally, feed it any furnace fuel using any item transportation (such as Hoppers) into its interactable side (or its extension through a Mechanical Core) and it'll start digging.

You'll need to extract the Ember Shards it collects using any item extracting device, such as the Item Extractor and Item Pipe the mod provide. Simply place the Extractor on one of the interactable sides, power it with redstone, lay down Pipes to the inventory you want to fill and you'll be able to collect what the Bore has been collecting.

The Ember Activator is a machine that will turn Ember Shards and Crystals into useable energy, usually called Ember.

Simply place it down, use any item automation to input Shards/Crystals into its bottom part and it will generate Ember (energy) that will be stored in its upper part.

To actually use this Ember, you'll need Ember Emitters and Receptors. Place an Emitter on the source (here the top part of your Ember Activator), place a Receptor on a machine that can accept it. Then, sneak + right click the Receptor with the Tinker's Hammer, right click the Emitter and power it with redstone and Ember should start flowing.

Note that a single Emitter can also only power a single Receptor, but a single Receptor can receive power from multiple Emitters. If you want to use a single Emitter to power multiple Receptors, you'll need Beam Splitters.

The Melter is a machine that allows you to melt various metals using Ember.

Simply place it down, input valid items in its bottom part and Ember, and it will melt them into a liquid that can be extracted from the top block.

The Stamper is another machine that allows you to turn those molten metals into useable materials.

Place the Stamper Base down, then place the Stamper itself 2 blocks above it (1 empty block between the two) and put a Stamp inside of it. Input the liquid in the Base and input Ember in the Stamper and it should start working.

You can place a Bin under the Stamper Base to automatically collect what it's producing.

The Bin is a simple container that can hold 1 stack of an item.

While it is pretty unimpressive, several machines from this mod will automatically output their work into a Bin right under them, which greatly simplifies their automation process.

The Ember and Fluid Dials are tools that can be placed on the side of any Ember or Fluid container from this mod, respectively.

When hovered over, they will respectively display the Ember level and Fluid content of the machine, which is especially useful since there are no other ways of getting such information.

The Mixer Centrifuge is a machine that allows you to mix molten metals into molten alloys using Ember.

Each of the 4 faces of the bottom block is its own tank. Supply them with a valid combinaison of liquids and feed the top block with Ember and it'll mix them together, making a new fluid that can be pumped out from the top block.

Most alloys you can make with this can also be made in other ways, with the exception of Dawnstone which will be used for more advanced recipes.

The Crusher is a machine that allows you to crushes things for RF. Many tech mods add a very similar machine (such as Thermal Expansion's Pulverizer), so don't be surprised if its description feels familiar.

It can be used to crush flowers into more dyes than if you were to craft them by hand, crush ores into dust, which allows you to collect 2x as much ingots from a single ore if you were to just directly put then in a Furnace, and turn Cobblestone into Sand amongst other things. All operations require RF.

The Copper Charger is a machine that allows charging items with Ember.

Simply place any item that can accept Ember in it by right clicking and feed the Charger with Ember. The item will then charge using the Ember contained in the Charger.

The most useful use for this is charging Mantle Jars and Cartridges. Both are portable Ember batteries that can be used by various powerful tools (such as the Blazing Ray) when in your inventory. Jars can be accessed from anywhere in your inventory by those tools, but Cartridges need to be held in your hand (but can contain more Ember).

The Dawnstone Anvil is a block that allows repairing tools and dissambling them.

To repair a tool, simply place it on the Anvil, then place its repair material on it. Right click the Anvil a bunch of time using the Tinker's Hammer and the item will enventually be repaired.

To dissassemble a tool, do the same process but without placing the repair material on top of the tool before smashing it with the Hammer. Not all tools can be dissassembled, but most common ones should be.

The Automatic Hammer is a way to automate the process on smashing your Tinker's Hammer on the Dawnstone Anvil.

Simply place it above the Anvil, feed it Ember and power it with redstone and it'll start smacking the Anvil just like you would manually.

The Cinder Plinth is a simple machine that uses Ember to turn any item into Ash Piles.

Insert the items you wish to burn in it (can be manually done via right clicking) and feed it Ember and it'll start burning them into Ash Piles. Placing a Bin under it will allow you to automatically gather them.

Ash Piles can be used as small furnace fuel, each being able to smelt 1 item, or can be used to make decorative blocks along with Stone. They also play an important role in Energetic Alchemy later on.

The Beam Cannon is a deadly machine that can fire lasers using Ember.

To aim it, place it down, sneak + right click a target block with the Tinker's Hammer then right click the Cannon. You can then feed it Ember and, when you need to fire it, give it a redstone signal (doesn't respond to pulses immediatly, use a Lever or similar instead of a Button).

This beam can kill nearly any unarmored creature, including you if you're not careful, but is also used to start the Exchange Tablet.

The Exchange Tablet is a machine that allows performing Energetic Alchemy.

Place the Tablet somewhere, place some Alchemy Pedestal near it, and aim a Beam Cannon at it to set it up.

To perform a recipe, first insert all required items by right clicking the various faces (top and all 4 sides) of the Tablet with the items in hand, then insert appropriate Aspectus on the Pedestals. Fill the Pedestals with an amount of Ash Pile within the range displayed in JEI (for example Netherrack requires between 8 and 16 Ash Piles on the Pedestal with the Copper Aspectus), and fire the Beam Cannon to finish the process.

The amount of Ash Piles a certain recipe needs depends on the world's seed, but is always within the displayed ranges. If you put too much or not enough Ash Piles into certain Aspectus, you'll get Alchemical Waste instead of the desired item.

Those Wastes will tell how by how much you were wrong, allowing you to note down the actual require amounts for a specific recipe, and can be recycled into Ash Piles in a Stamper.

The Ashen Armor is an armor made using Dawnstone and Ashen Fabric. It grants a good amount of protection on top of being incredibly classy.

Their most important feature however is the ability to stitch attuned Inflictor Gems to the Ashen Cloak.

Holding an Inflictor Gem in your hand while taking any form of damage will attune it to this specific damage source. Putting this attuned Gem along with a piece of String and the Cloak in a crafting grid will stitch them together, reducing damage taken from this specifc source by about a third.

Up to 7 Gems can be stitched on the Cloak, and they can be removed by placing the Cloak in an empty crafting grid.

Isolated Materia is an item that can be used as a substitute for any repairing material in the Dawnstone Anvil.

Use it as you would for any repairing material to repair your tools or armor. This is especially useful to repair expensive tools.

Ancient Motive Cores are dropped by Ancient Golems found at night, or can be crafted once you get your hands on the Exchange Tablet.

While you probably used one already to make the Ancient Codex, they can also be strapped on any tool, weapon or armor at the Dawnstone Anvil. Simply place your item followed by the Core and slam them down either with your Tinker's Hammer or an Automatic Hammer.

Once the Core is placed, your item will be able to gather Heat simply by being used.

While you won't be able to do anything with this Heat before getting the Inferno Forge, since it can take quite some time to fill the bar we encourage you to start gathering Heat now, so that you can immediatly use the Inferno Forge once you get your hands on it.

The Inferno Forge is a big machine that allows you to gain Levels on your tools, weapons and armor you have managed to fill their Heat bar (see Gathering Heat quest).

Simply place it down, put a Mechanical Core under its center bottom block and feed it Ember. When you have a tool ready to be leveled, open the hatch on the top by right clicking it, and throw it inside along with any number of Ember Crystals.

Close the hatch once that's done and it should start fuming if you did it correctly. Once it's done, you can get your tool back and hopefully it will have gained a Level. The more Ember Crystals you threw in it, the more likely it is to suceed.

Various Modifiers can be strapped on a tool with a Level at the Dawnstone Anvil, just like you strapped the Core to gather Heat in the first place. The various Modifiers are detailled inside the Ancient Codex, and you can put them multiple times to increase their level. Note that you can't get Modifiers to a higher Level than your tool's, which means you'll need to use it more if you wish to make the Modifiers more powerful.

Inventory Tweaks is a mod that adds convenience for inventory management.

Its main features allow quick sorting of any inventory (be it yours or a Chest's) by a single mouse middle click or the sorting key (R by default), as well as automatic replacement of broken tools/emptied block stacks in your hand.

For example, you have multiple stacks of Cobblestone that you are placing down. Once you placed an entire stack, instead of having to scroll to the next stack or go to your inventory to put them in your hotbar, Inventory Tweaks will automatically move one to your active hotbar slot.

Mouse Tweaks is a mod that adds convenience when moving items around inventories.

Here is a run-through of its features :
-Holding right click while dragging an item accross multiple slots will, as always, deposit one of each in each slot, with the difference being that you can pass over the same slot multiple times in order to deposit more than one item
-Holding left click while picking up an item and dragging it accross multiple slots will allow you to pick up all stacks of the same item along the way, holding shift will "shift left click" them instead of adding them to the dragged stack
-Holding shift and left click then dragging accross items will do the same as if you "shif left clicked" each individual one you pass over
-Scrolling down while hovering over an item in an open inventory (like a Chest) will "shift left click" it to the other inventory

Welcome to IC2! 

It offers a lot, such as ore doubling, power generation, item duplication, tools and armor. You need to craft an Advanced Machine Case in order to progress into Industrial Foregoing.

Hint: If you cannot be bothered with making IC2 generators, you can convert RF into EU with Mekanism.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the IndustrialCraft questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8: The most basic generator. It produces EU out of burnables such as coal and wood.
The Macerator can grind up various things, and double ores.
This is a crafting ingredient needed to craft higher tier Industrialcraft machines, aswell as being the main ingredient in the§4 Industrial Foregoing§0 Machine Case.

The §lME IO Port§r is used to automatically transfer items stored on up to 6 Storage Cells (and similar devices) into the Cells installed in connected §lME Drives§r.

  Storage Cells go in the left hand slots of the GUI, and when they are emptied they will appear in the right hand slots.

  You can specify the direction of the data transfer, either from the Cells into the ME network, or from the ME network into the Cells.  The latter direction is handy to fill up partitioned Cells or newer, higher tiered Cells.

  Storage Cells in the §lME IO Port §rwill not be available to the ME network, they must be installed in an ME Drive.

§lP2P Tunnels§r allow for various things to go through the ME Cables, such as items, fluids, energy, redstone signals, light levels and §l§oeven other channels§r.

  §lP2P Tunnels§r are changed by placing them in-world, at clicking them with a item that would connect to the P2P type you want, so for P2P Tunnel - Item, click it with an Itemduct.  When first crafting a Tunnel, it will be the §lP2P Tunnel - ME§r which is used for §l§ochannel multiplexing§r and will be covered in another quest.

  We'll instead start off with an easy example: §lP2P Tunnel - Item§r (referred to as an §oItem Tunnel§r) will accept items pushed into it and transfer them to inventories attached to linked §oItem Tunnels§r.

  Linking is performed by Sneak + Right-Clicking a §lMemory Card§r on the §oItem Tunnel§r that is going to be the input.  Then, Right-Click the §lMemory Card§r on any other §oItem Tunnel§r to set it to be an output.

  §lTunnels§r are pushed in the order that you linked them, so the first §oItem Tunnel§r that you linked will have items pushed to it first.  When the inventory at the first §oTunnel§r fills up, the second §oTunnel§r will be pushed to, then the third, and so on.

  §lTunnels§r must all be powered and on the same ME network to function, but otherwise do not need anything special.

This section covers the other types of §lP2P Tunnels§r, unless otherwise noted, they have the same requirements and linking behavior as §oItem Tunnels§r.

  §lP2P Tunnel - Light§r is a unique device that senses the light level in the block in front of it and transmits the light to all linked §oLight Tunnels§r.  It will sense and transmit light from the sky as well as any light emitting blocks (torches, etc.)

  §lP2P Tunnel - Redstone§r will transmit any redstone signals that the block space in front of it happens to have.  Redstone signal levels do not lose any strength while traversing the ME system, so for all linked §oRedstone Tunnels§r its as if the attached blocks where adjacent to the input block space.  They are however, one-way: redstone signals at the output Tunnels will not travel to the input Tunnel.

  §l§oEnergy Tunnels§r allow transmission of energy through the ME system to all linked destinations.  Each supported energy type will have their own §oEnergy Tunnel§r variation, and likewise will only link to Tunnels of the same variation; §oEU Tunnels§r won't link to §oForge Energy Tunnels§r, and vice versa.

  Other mods may add more types of §lP2P Tunnels§r, such as §oFluid Tunnels§r and §oOpenComputer Tunnels§r.  Their operating requirements and linking behavior is the same, the only difference is what is transferred.  Usually their name is a good enough clue as to what they do.

Up until now, you've been limited to 8 channels for most types of cables, and can get up to 32 channels with the relatively expensive Dense Cables.

  The §lP2P Tunnel - ME§r variant we skipped over before allows us to go little  past that limit through a method called §l§ochannel multiplexing§r.  What this does is cram up to 32 channels into 1 or 2 channels - the channels used to link two §oME Tunnels§r together.  This ultimately allows for a maximum of 256 through a humble Glass Cable... §mor possibly more.§r

§lNote:§r  Tunneling may have an impact on the responsiveness of the ME system, if you find that your devices at the other end of a tunnel feel a bit sluggish, you may need to run a Dense Cable to there instead of using tunnels.

  Standard tunneling requirements and behavior apply - The tunnels must be powered and linked together to function.

  Right-Click an ME Tunnel on a cable to install it on the cable.

  Sneak + Right-Click to have it attach to/look at the cable; all channels on the cable will be available for tunneling.

  There several differences worth mentioning that §oME Tunnels§r have over the others:

  The first of which is that §oME Tunnels§r are §l§obi-directional§r, all linked §oTunnels§r can push and pull ME requests, although they are all limited to a maximum of 32 channels.

§lNote:§r  §oME Tunnels§r seem to behave better if §l§othey are in pairs§r. Two or more output §oTunnels§r per input §oTunnel§r can have less total channel capacity or behave strangely.

  Secondly, there must be an §lME controller§r somewhere on the ME network that the Tunnels are handling, otherwise the maximum is limited to 8 channels (which makes the use of the §oME Tunnels§r moot).

  Finally, §oME Tunnels§r §l§ocannot self-reference§r, meaning they cannot input from/output to a cable that eventually connects to themselves or their linked partners.  They can, however, be connected to the same ME network if they go through an §lME Controller§r.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Please Sir, May I Have Some More?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The §lMatter Condenser§r is used to create §lMatter Balls§r and §lSingularities§r.

  §lMatter Balls§r are ammunition for the §lMatter Cannon§r, and is described in detail in the Cannon's quest.

  §lSingularities§r are a crafting component for items used later in this quest line.

  The §lMatter Condenser§r is in §l§oTrash Mode§r when it is first placed down, anything put in the slot marked with a trash can  in its GUI will be destroyed instantly.

  The button on the right of the GUI cycles between §l§oTrash Mode§r and the two §o§lCondense§r modes.

  There must be a §lStorage Component§r installed in the top slot of the GUI, or neither of the §l§oCondense§r modes will work and the items will simply be destroyed.

  The cost to create either Matter Balls or Singularities is in number of items, and all types of items contribute the same amount, so use something cheap and abundant such as Cobble, Dirt, or any "trash" item.


  The§l Matter Condenser§r does not require power to function.

§lTiny TNT§rs are cheap, and super low-powered versions of their more destructive breathrin.  They are particularly useful in AE2 for the creation of §lQuantum Entangled Singularities§r, which are used to link two §lQuantum Ring§rs together.  Other mods which use explosive crafting may benefit from Tiny TNTs, as well.

  A pair of §lQuantum Entangled Singularities§r are created by tossing 1 §lEnder Dust§r and 1 §lSingularity§r onto the ground, and then create an explosion nearby.  If using the §lTiny TNT§r as the explosion source, it must be in the same block space as the two ingredients when lit.

The §l§oME Quantum Ring multiblock§r is used to link two ME networks together, from any distance, from any dimension.  It does however take up a significant amount of power.

  The multiblock is composed of 8 §lME Quantum Ring§r blocks in a donut shape (either verticle or horizontal) and a single §lME Quantum Link Chamber§r in the center.  There must be a multiblock at both ME networks, and they both must have a §lQuantum Entangle Singularity (QES)§r in them.

  The §lQES§r is always crafted in pairs, and contains data that links the two Rings togetherat a quantum level... theoretically.

  Both rings must be powered in order for the link to establish.  Once the link is active, however, they can draw power from either side.

  A maximum of 32 channels may go through the ring (before tunneling), and cables may connect to any of the Quantum Ring Blocks that are not in the corners.

The §lColor Applicator§r is used to paint cables and wool blocks placed in the world to different colors according to the §lPaintballs§r loaded in it.  It may also be able to paint similar blocks, as well.

  Colors are cycled through by Sneak + Right-Clicking on any block that won't accept color.  See the quest for the §lMatter Cannon§r for loading and charging instructions.

The §lSpatial IO Port§r is used in conjunction with the §lSpatial Pylons§r to store and relocate blocks constructed in the world.  (So cool...)

  Constructions are stored in special "pocket dimensions" and are managed by §lSpatial Storage Cells§r.  These are tiered based on the amount of blocks per side they can hold. 

Note:  Many multiplayer servers have a policy on how many dimensions players can make. Since this policy applies to Spatial Storage usage.

  The §lPylons§r are built in four edges to the space that they will be digitizing.  A common set up is to build pillars of Pylon blocks that go upwards.  The minimum valid multblock construction size (referred to as the §l§oSpatial Containment Structure§r) is a 3x3x3 cube. which will store/transfer a single block in the middle.

  To start the digitization process, a valid Spatial Containment Structure (SCS) must be built and connected via cables to the Spatial IO Port.  Both the SCS and IO Port need power, but otherwise don't need anything special.

Note:  Only 1 SCS may exist on any ME network.

  Place a §lSpatial Storage Cell§r in the left hand slot of the §lSpatial IO Port§r's GUI, then supply a redstone signal to the IO Port to initiate the process.  If the Spatial Storage Cell happens to have something in it at the time digitizing occurs, it will be swapped with the whatever is within the SCS.

§4§l§oWarning!§r §n§oAnything§r within the SCS at the time of the redstone signal will get digitized, including mobs and players (there's an advancement for this).  You will need some form of teleportation to get out of of there, a Nether Portal, a redstone contraption to re-trigger the IO Port, or a friend to push the button on the IO Port.

§lView Cells§r are used in conjunction with the §lCell Workbench§r, and may be installed in most types of §lME Terminals§r.

  §lView Cells§r act as a filter for the ME Terminal, meaning that the Terminal will only show the items that are configured on the View Cells that are installed in it.

  This means that you can make a "Frequently Used Items" view cell and plop it in a Terminal whenever you need it, instead of needing to use the search bar all the time.

  It can also be used dedicate Terminals for some particular purpose, such as a "Kitchen Terminal."

§l§oContinous Autocrafting§r can be set up relatively easily with §lME Import§r and §lExport Busses§r, but most often you'll need some form of control over the machines to prevent them from overcrafting.

  AE2 offers several devices that allow for some redstone control,  The §lME Toggle Bus§r (covered in §nCrystal Production 201§r), the §lRedstone Upgrade Card§r (covered in §nUp Doots§r), and the §lME Level Emitter§r.

  The §lME Level Emitter§r will monitor a configured item and will emit a redstone signal if the stocks are above or below a set level.

  It can also monitor the energy levels present in the ME system, which can be used, for example, to turn on a backup generator of sorts.

  If a §lCrafting Card§r is installed, it will emit a signal whenever the monitored item has an active crafting request.

Many AE2 devices and machines are able to accept §l§oUpgrade Cards§r.  These are usually installed in dedicated slots found their GUI, in the upper right hand corner with the outline of a §lBasic Card§r drawn on them.

  Handheld devices, such as the §lMatter Cannon§r, and §lView Cells§r can have Upgrade Cards installed at the §lCell Workbench§r. 

  Each Card's tooltip describe where the Card may be installed.  Numbers in parenthesis indicate the maximum number of Cards that device may have.

  The following is a short overview of what each Card does:

§lCapacity§r:  Increase the number of slots in the device's filter.

§lCrafting§r:  The device is able to request the crafting of configured items.  For example, an export bus configured to export Wood Planks will continously request them to be crafted until the attached inventory is full.

§lFuzzy§r:  The device will ignore NBT and damage data, and will use the Ore Dictionary equivalents of the configured items.

§lInverter§r:  Changes the device's filters from a whitelist into a blacklist.  Items in the filter will NOT be pulled/requested.

§lRedstone§r:  Allows the device to be controlled by redstone signals.  Behavior is configured in the device's GUI with a new button.

§lAcceleration§r:  Increases the operating speed of the device.  For busses, this increases the stack size per transfer.

§lApplied Energistics 2§r is centered around inventory managment using high-tech machines which theoretically convert§r §0Matter into Energy and back again.  A vanilla style store room containing hundreds of double chests can be digitized through the ME system and fit onto a single storage cell, freeing up all that space in the world to be used by more interesting things.

  §lVids, Plox?§r  There are several youtube tutorials over AE2, if you prefer.  (Sorry, hyperlinks not supported in BQM) :(

§9§nhttps://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=applied+energistics+2+tutorial§r

  You can also check out the official wiki!

§r§9§nhttp://ae-mod.info/

The first machine you will need to make is the §lQuartz Grindstone§r§r.

  The §lGrindstone§r is used to crush up Nether Quartz and Certus Quartz into dust, which is then used in crafting recipes such as Quartz Fiber (core component of ME cables), Quartz Glass (used to make several machines), and Quartz Seeds.

 To use the §lGrindstone§r, place the items you wish to grind up in the machine via its GUI. Then, place a §lWooden Crank§r on top of the grindstone and hold down right click to get cranking. The crank will spin around to indicate that it is working. Yes, the process is slow.

Some recipes may require §lPure Nether Quartz§o§r or §lPure Certus Quartz§r. These are obtained by dropping a §lSeed§r of their respective crystal into a water block and waiting §mforever and a day§r. Since the Grindstone can produce 2 or more dusts per quartz ore, this can be a method of increasing your crystal stocks.

  Note: Some recipes, such as Fluix crystals, require the natural Certus and Nether Quartz, so don't grind up your entire stock!

§lFluix Crystals§r are a key component to many machines in AE2. Unlike Certus and Nether Quartz, §lFluix§r must be crafted in a unique manner.

  However, you first need a §lCharged Certus Quartz§r crystal. These may be found in the world in ores, and look like normal Certus Quartz ore with lightning bolts zapping across them occasionally.

  Once you have your Charged Certus, drop it in a block of calm water along with 1 redstone dust and 1 Nether Quartz. The three will be consumed and a §lFluix Crystal§r will materialize after a few seconds.

  You can also make §lPure Fluix Crystals§r using the same method you learned in §nCrystal Production 101§r.

Since §lCharged Certus Quartz§r can be difficult to find naturally in the world sometimes, it would be a good idea to make something that can energize natural §lCertus Quartz§r. The §lCharger§r does exactly that.

  The §lCharger§r operates in a similar manner to the Grindstone; place a natural Certus Quartz into the charger by right-clicking the §lCharger§r with the Quartz in hand. Then, place a wooden crank on the top of the machine and get cranking.

  Tip: You can place an ME cable on the top or bottom of the Charger, and it'll take in power from the ME system instead of using the hand crank.

The Matter Energy (ME) system will only ever work if it is powered.  AE2 provides a simple generator called the §lVibration Chamber§r which will consume burnables and generate a trickle of energy for the ME system.

  However, most players forego making the Vibration Chamber and instead use a more powerful generator from another mod, and then use an §lEnergy Acceptor§r to power the ME system.

Note: The §lEnergy Acceptor§r will only ever take energy from an outside source and will only ever output energy to the ME system.

In order to transfer ME across the ME system, the machines must either be adjacent to one another or have optical cables connecting them.

  §lQuartz Fibers§r are the foundation of all the cables in AE2. They may be placed in the word, but don't actually connect anything.

  §lME Glass Cables§r are the basic tier of AE2 cables, and can support up to 8 connected devices on a line.

  §lME Covered Cables§r are also basic tier, and are largely viewed as a crafting step toward §lME Smart Cables§r. Some contest they look a bit better, too.

  §lME Smart Cables§r also connect up to 8 devices, but they visually show how many devices are connected and will turn red if there's a conflict of some sort.

  §lME Dense Cables§r are the top tier cables and can support up to 32 connected devices. They also show how many devices are connected.

Note:  Dense Cables will not function if there isn't an §lME Controller§r somewhere on the network.

Hint:  AE2 machines act like ME Glass Cables when doing adjacent connections, supporting up to 8 devices.

Before progressing much further into AE2, you're going to have to bit of exploring to find §lmeteorites§r. These are large chunks of §lSky stone§r that are generated throughout the world, and tend to make a huge crater.  §lSky stone§r is an obsidian level mining block, so be sure to have a pickaxe (or other tool) that can collect it.

  These meteorites can be found easily with a §lMeteorite Compass§r, which will point towards chunks that have Skystone blocks in them (even a single block). If you don't see the meteorite anywhere, then it's probably buried undergound.

  Inside the center of each of the meteorites is a §lSky Stone Chest§r, which can hold §lInscriber Press Plates§r. These are essential to the progession into AE2, and can sometimes be difficult to find, especially in a crowded server. Thankfully they can make copies of themselves in an §lInscriber§r, so long as you have one to begin with.

Now that you have §lInscriber Press Plates§r, a bit of §lSky Stone§r, and a powered ME network, you can start making circuits with the §lInscriber§r.

  The Inscriber must be powered to function.

  You should consult JEI to see all available recipes for the §lInscriber§r.

Tip: You should make 1 §lInscriber§r per plate, and at least 1 more for processor crafting. This is not necassary, but it does aide in automation.

Tip: Hoppers can pipe in crafting ingredients to the §lInscriber§r from any side.

§lME Drives§r are devices that allow the ME system to read and write to §lStorage Cells§r.  This is like your computer's DVD drive, with the DVD's being the Storage Cells.

 §lStorage Cells§r contain solid items, and can contain §oany§r type of item.  Other mods and addons may add specialized versions§r which behave in a similar manner, such as the §lFluid Storage Cell§r which will hold mB's of fluid instead of items.

  §lStorage Cells§r have a limited amount of space of them, and are tiered.

  §lStorage Cells §rmay be taken out of the §lDrive§r at any time, the items stored on them are safe so long as the cell isn't destroyed in fire, lava, cactus, explosion, etc.

The §lME Controller§r isn't actually needed if you'll be using AE2 just for basic storage.  It does however sport four important features that may be needed if you decide to progress further.

  The first of which is an §l§oenergy buffer§r.  Both the §lVibration Chamber§r and the §lEnergy Acceptor§r don't have such a buffer.  This can cause stability problems when the ME system starts to grow, as some machines will prioritize power flow over others, causing the others to lose power and possibly shut down.

  The second feature is that it enables the use of §lME Dense Cables§r, which will not function without an ME Controller somewhere in the ME system.

  The third feature is a large number of §l§ochannels§r.  Each side of the §lME Controller§r can accept up to 32 channels (which is the capacity of a §lME Dense Cable§r), making for a maximum of 192 devices on a single Controller.

  The last feature is that the §lController§r may be a §l§omultiblock§r construction, adding more available channels and more energy storage per block.  Each Controller may have up to 3 adjacent Controllers to it on the same plane (T's, no +'s) and have a maximum of 4 controllers altogether (+ with a bent leg).  The entire multiblock may be no larger than a 7x7x7 cube.

§lME Terminals§r are used to interact with most other devices on the ME network, most notably the §lME Drives§r.  They are a type of multipart block which will sit in the same space as the cable they are connected to, and installation is as easy as placing them on a cable.

  The §lTerminal§r should light up to indicate that it connected successfully and has sufficient power.  If it is dark, check that your smart cables show you have an available channel and check your power supplier.  Remember that all devices (aside from cables) will consume a bit of energy, even when not in use.

  Right-click on the §lTerminal §rto access its GUI.  Here, you can treat the "Grid" just like you would an ordinary chest inventory.  When depositing items, you don't have to place it into a specific spot, the Grid is automatically sorted.

  The left hand side of the GUI has a number of buttons that affect sorting and terminal style, you should play around with them a bit to see what they all do.

  The top of the GUI has a §o§lsearch bar§r.  Some addon mods can link this search bar with the JEI search bar, in which case there would be a button to toggle the settings.

  §lME Crafting Terminals§r add a 3x3 crafting grid to the GUI.  Here, you can craft things right at the terminal without needing to move back and forth between a crafting table.  Items left on the grid will stay there until you remove them or clear the grid.

Cables can be seperated from each other or specific AE2 devices by using §lCable Anchors§r. These are a type of "multipart" construction, and may placed directly on the cable or vice versa.

  Cables can also be dyed, either in the crafting grid or in the world with a §lMatter Cannon§r loaded with paintballs. Dyed cables won't connect to other cables of different colors, with the exception of the Fluix color.

§lME Chests§r are an alternative to §lME Drives§r. They have a built-in §lME Terminal§r on the top of them to allow access to the solitary §lStorage Cell§r in their inventory, which can be swapped out by interacting with the front side of the chest.

  Hint: They make loading the §lMatter Cannon§r real easy.

§lEnergy Cells§r are blocks that can store energy from §lEnergy Acceptors§r or §lVibration Chambers§r and make the power available to the ME system.  If you find that you are having power fluctuations in the system, you can try placing down more §lEnergy Cells§r instead of§l ME Controllers§r to increase the overall power buffer.

  A lesser known feature of Energy Cells is that they can be charged in a §lCharger§r and then placed in the world to use.  Unfortunately, they will not retain their energy if broken after being placed.

The §lMatter Cannon§r is used to shoot §lMatter Balls §rand §lPaintballs§r at a short distance - about the same as a normal tool.

  When armed with §lMatter Balls§r, the Cannon can insta-break soft blocks that can be broken by hand, and can damage mobs with a power similar to an empty hand.  It does, however, have a very fast rate of fire.

  When armed with §lPaintballs§r, the Cannon can dye sheep and some mobs without hurting them (they will still feel a bit of a sting, though).  Paintballs can also stick to solid blocks, which may be used to mark points of interest or mildly annoy your neighbors.  The §lLux Paintballs§r glow in the dark, too.

  The Matter Cannon needs both energy and ammo to function. It can be charged in the §k§l§r§lCharger§r, and can be loaded from the ME system by treating it like a partitioned Storage Cell.  Using a §lME Chest§r is the easiest way to load the Cannon.

Once you have gotten a power source for your ME system, you can create §lCrystal Growth Accelerators§r to greatly speed up the growth of Pure Quartz and Pure Fluix crystals.

  These are placed adjacent to and facing the water block that the crystal seeds will be in, and must be connected to the ME system with suitable cables.  Theoretically you can place a maximum of 6 Accelerators around a water source block, but you'll need a way of getting the seeds in and the crystals out.

  Since the Accelerators can eat up a significant amount of power, a method of easily turning them on and off would be desired.  The §lME Toggle Bus§r is one solution, as it will turn on power and device access between connected cables/devices when it senses a redstone signal.  These are multipart components, and take up the same space as a cable.  To install them, you can place them directly on a cable or on the side of an AE2 device.

  An inverted version of the ME Toggle Bus exists, as well. These turn off when sensing a redstone signal.

Now in Minecraft it's no secret you need to defend yourself. With Creepers, Zombies, Skeletons and worse. . . baby mobs, we need to protect ourselves. That's where the sword comes in. Of course in order to make a good sword, we need a pattern like usual.

Let's go ahead and make the §l'Sword Blade Pattern'§0 and the §l'Wide Guard Pattern'§0.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Defense? Offense? Which will YOU choose?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Now that we have stencils, we want to get some tools made. One of the most important tools of course is the pickaxe. I mean it §oIS§0 called §l'MIN§l§lE§l§l§l§l§0craft' for a reason, right?

Anyways lets get some §l'Flint'§0 and make our first §l'Pickaxe Head'§0. This will be a good start until we're ready to make the smeltery.

These Flux Gates can limit how much RF flows through them, based on Redstone signal (on or off).
They are very useful when it comes to controlling the flow of your Draconic Reactor.
You will need 2 of them, one for the energy input, and one for the energy output.
Alright we've got the stencils, now we need the parts. Make a §l'Part Builder'§0 by using one log and a §l'Blank Pattern'§0 on top in a crafting grid.

Once we have all the parts, we need to be able to put them together. That's where the §l'Tool Station'§0 comes into play. Let's make that so we can put our tools together.

The§l 'Tool Station'§0 allows us to put together, repair, and modify only the basic tools. If we want things like the §l'Crossbow'§0 or §l'Shuriken'§0, for example, ee'll need the §l'Tool Forge'§0 but we'll get to that one a bit later.

Before we can move on from crude tools and weapons, we need to make the smeltery to make all of the good stuff.

To start out, lets get some §l'Grout'§0 made. A stack should do nicely, but two stacks would be great. To make §l'Grout'§0, you will need §l'Clay'§0, §l'Sand'§0, and §l'Gravel'§0. If you need the recipe, check §lJEI§0 or §l'Materials and You'§0 for more details.

Finally the last part we need is the §l'Sword Blade'§0 and §l'Wide Guard'§0. Why you ask? Well unless you're playing on §oPeaceful§0, we'll need to defend ourself from monsters like those pesky Zombies.

We have the pickaxe head pattern and now we have the binding and tool rod patterns. Next is the shovel, because let's face it. We're going to want to dig at some point right? Let's craft the §l'Shovel Head Pattern'§0.
One of the staples of Minecraft is chopping trees. You can do it bare-handed . . . or we can make an axe. In order to make one, we need the §l'Axe Head Pattern'§0.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Axe Me A Question...I Dare You

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Besides mining, we'll also be doing a bunch of digging.

Really it's quite inevitable. 

While you can dig using your stumps called hands, shovels make the job much easier. Let's take the stencil for the §l'Shovel Head'§0 and make it.

Okay so we have a few pieces now, but next we'll need to be able to cut trees down. Like we mentioned in the previous quest, using your stumps is quite inefficient.

Let's make the §l'Axe Head'§0. This will make chopping those pesky trees down much easier. And faster too.
The Battle Sign is interesting weapon. It's a defensive weapon that has low damange but works excellently as a shield and blocks projectiles.

The §l'Tinker Tank'§0 is an interesting addition to the mod. It stores all sorts of liquid inside, and because there is no heat, it doesn't cause smelting nor does it create alloys. Great if you need a place to store excess liquids without mixing them. 

Like the Smeltery, the Tank too has a controller which allows us to interact with the Tank. Of course we need to get our stuff back out, so we can add in a drain to access and get those metals and liquids you have stored. Neat right?

In order to make all of the things needed to make the smeltery, we need some §l'Seared Bricks'§0. A LOT of them.

One stack should be sufficient.

Now the first sword we'll make wont be the best, though it will be better than nothing, but we can however make the sword better with a§l 'Sharpening Kit'§0. Just like everything else the kit needs a pattern too. Let's go ahead and make the §l'Sharpening Kit Pattern'§0 and then we'll tell you how it works in a little bit.

Just like the quest name says, §l'The Seared Tank'§0 and the §l'Smeltery Controller'§0 are the two items that makes it a Smeltery. The Controller we'll use to put in and monitor what we have in the Smeltery while the Tank is what heats the multiblock structure. You'll need the §l'Seared Brick'§0 that you made previously to make these as well as glass for the tank

The drain will allow us to pour the liquid metals into the §l'Casting Table'§0 or §l'Casting Basins'§0.

Then once we have the drain, we need the §l'Faucet'§0. The faucet guides the liquid into the table or the basin by right clicking to enable it.
In order to build the smeltery, we need some blocks to build it. That's where the §l'Seared Bricks'§0 come in.

We need to be able to pour our newly smelted stuff somewhere, so now we need a §l'Casting Basin'§0, which will make blocks of whatever you pour in there, and the §l'Casting Table'§0 which  you will use the §l'Casts'§0 with to make your tool and weapon parts.
Everyone loves windows right? Let's make some §l'Seared Glass'§0 to see what goes on in the smeltery.

Now that we have our basic smeltery up and running, the first thing we'll need to make is casts for the tool parts we're going to be making. 

Now you can make the casts out of clay if you wish, but they only last for one use. 

We are, however, going to make the sturdier ones made out of §lAluminum Brass §0which will be reusable.

We'll need 1 §lCopper§0 to 3 §lAluminum§0 in the smeltery. That will make 4 ingots. To make our casts now that we have §lAluminum Brass§0, we need a few tool parts made from the parts table. Right click it into the §l'Casting Table'§0 and then right click on the faucet. It will start pouring the cast over the tool part (It §lWILL§0 consume the tool part so make sure it's not made of something valuable). It will only use one ingot, so you will have 3 more casts worth of §lAluminum Brass§0. Let's make those and we can move on to the next quest.
Now you know how to make casts, let's make a Shovel Head cast and one for an Axe Head. Having a shovel and axe thatyou can repair will be very useful and also more efficient.
Let's make the casts for the §l'Wide Guard'§0 and the §l'Sword Blade'§0. This will allow us to make all those fancy custom swords.
Once you have your tools and weapons made, you may need them to be better. That's where the §l'Sharpening Kit'§0 comes in. Remember to combine the sharpening kit with a §l'Flint'§0 to use it.
If you end up having too much let over you can make them back into ingots (including Obsidian). We need an §l'Ingot Cast'§0 for that.

The Tinker Furnace

It is highly recommend that you read §l'Materials and You'§0 for more detailed information, but I'll give you a basic run down to get your started.

The first thing you will need is the §l'Furnace Controller'§0 and §nat least§0 enough Seared blocks to make a 3x3x3 structure and at least one §l'Seared Tank'§0 for fuel purposes. When building the structure, remember to leave the middle hollow, but make sure you have a floor and ceiling as well.

The Reactor Stabilizers are what keeps the Draconic Reactor from exploding.
The Draconic Reactor needs 4 Reactor Stabilizers, that all has to be placed in either a horizontal or vertical plane. Just like the Energy Core.
You also use these to take energy out of the Draconic Reactor, which is your net gain.
This is where the Flux Gates comes in handy.
Each Reactor Stabilizer can give a Comparator output, depending on the Redstone Mode it's set too.

Recommended that each Reactor Stabilizer is at least 4 blocks from the Reactor Core.

Let's get even better. Want to be able to chop down whole trees in one go? (No we're not talking about veinminer just so you know). We're talking about the Lumber Axe.

Want to be able to dig a 3x3 area of dirt, or mine a 3x3 area of stone? We can do that. Let's make the casts needed!
Ardite is an ore from the Nether and definitely one of the more valuable metals. We definitely want some of that.

Now that we have a pickaxe that we can grab Obsidian from, we can use some of that obsidian and make a sharpening kit. An Obsidian Sharpening Kit will allow you to get cobalt and Ardite from the Nether.
Cobalt, like Ardite, is a precious metal from the Nether. It is also used to make another metal, which you will learn about in the next quest. For now we need some Cobalt before we get there.
Manyullyn is made by mixing one part Ardite and one part Cobalt. A precious Metal that makes a strong, sturdy alloy that is excellent for tools and weapons.

The Reactor Energy Injector is what gives power to the Containment Field shield, and is therefor also the input for the Draconic Reactor.
This has to be placed on one of the 2 sides, where there's not a Reactor Stabilizer.
A Flux Gate is recommended to be used with this.
The Reactor Energy Injector can give out a Comparator output, depending on the Redstone Mode it's set to.

Recommended to be at least 4 blocks away from the Reactor Core.
Now that we have access to Manyullyn, we want a manyullyn Sharpening Kit to make our tools better.

This will be similar to the previous quest, the difference is that we're upgrading our upgraded flint pickaxe to be able to mine Obsidian.

Remember you need a flint to make the sharpening kit work!

The ultimate All-In-One tool.. well except ranged weapon.
It gains all the benefits of Sword, Pickaxe, Axe and Shovel.
Attack and Dig AOE radius can be changed individually in the Draconic GUI.

When fully upgraded and enchanted, it is a beast to behold.

The Staff of Power comes with +3 Reaper enchant.

Bonus Quest!

Do you like pans? I do.

The Frypan is really neat. It deals bonus damage and knocks the enemies back. Not only that but is cooks the drops when you use the charged blow (Right click).

In order to make the tool, we need a few more parts. Of course in order to craft those parts we need patterns for them. 

So now we need a §l'Binding Pattern'§0 and a §l'Tool Rod Pattern'§0. These patterns are pretty important as they are used in many different tools.

Most of all the tools and weapons we'll make using §nTinkers' Construct§0 will need the §l'Tool Binding'§0. It's what holds the pieces together, so lets make a few of those. 

Then once we have the bindings, we need to be able to hold the tool or weapon right? We'll now makea §l'Tool Rod'§0 or two as well.

You have the cast, let's take our §l'Flint Pickaxe'§0 and combine it with an §l'Iron Sharpening Kit'§0. This will allow you to mine Iron-level ores and goodies. Just put the tool, Sharpening Kit and Flint in the Tool Station (or Tool Forge alternatively) and grab your upgraded tool!
The §l'Tool Forge'§0 is basically the §l'Tool Station'§0 but upgraded. When you have this table, you can make the better weapons and tools like the Lumber Axe, the Excavator, etc.

A small entity detector, that can.... detect nearby enemies.
It has serveral settings, and takes power everytime it scans for new entities.
The power cost is per Pulse, and the cost of a Pulse depends on the range of the detector.
It can pulse between every 1.5s and 60s.
It has settings for how many entities needs to be within range to give a certain redstone signal.
And it has some basic entity filters.
Redstone Output can be either Fixed or Pulse

For some extra information, check the Draconic Tablet.
This Entity Detector does not detect Item Entities.

In Draconic Evolution it is possible to control, and change spawners.
First you need to find a mob spawner though, but you must §cnot§0 break it (like you do in EnderIO).
Then right click it with any Draconic Core, and it will drop as an item. This will consume the core.

Your new Spawner doesn't use any power, and can be turned off with a redstone signal.
The efficiency of the spawner depends on the core thats on top of it. It is possible to replace the core, just right click with another core, and you will get the old one back. More information in the Draconic Tablet on what each tier of Core allows.
You can also change the type of mob that the spawner spawns, but getting a Mob Soul.
Mob Souls have a very low chance to drop when killed by a sword with the Reaper enchant. More on that in the Enchants quest.

§cBreaking a Stabilized Mob Spawner will cause it to lose its current soul.

All the armor, tools and weapons from Draconic Evolution are enchantable.
The only way to enchant them, is in an Anvil with an Enchanted Book.
A good way to get Enchants is Fishing, Dungeons and Disenchanting gear with the Disenchanter. This costs Levels to use.

Draconic Evolution also adds a new enchant: Reaper. This goes up to V, and does not interfere with anything else.
Reaper increases the chance to get Mob Souls when killing mobs. The chance of getting a Mob Soul is 1000/ReaperEnchLvl. So a Diamond Sword with Reaper V, will have 1 in 200 chance on mob kill to drop a Mob Soul.
Wyvern Sword comes with +1 to Reaper (Max of Reaper VI, 1 in 166 chance)
Draocnic Sword comes with +2 to Reaper (Max of Reaper VII, 1 in 142 chance)
Staff of Power comes with +3 to Reaper (Max of Reaper VIII, 1 in 125 chance)

§m-------------------------------------------------------------------------
§m§k§l§m§m§n§o§rItem Settings:
Most of Draconic Evolution items has settings of some sorts. To change those settings, you need to go into the Draconic GUI (default "C")
§cNOTE: This conflicts with the default Psi keybind, which takes priority, so you may have to change either keybind to something else.
§0Once you're in the GUI, you can click each Draconic item to change their settings, and change the Profile name, and you can re-position and resize the HUD too.

Profiles:
Each item also holds up to 5 Profile settings, which can change between (default "BACKSLASH")
Filler quest to open the End Crystals quest.

Upgraded version of the Entity Detector.
It does the same as the standard version, with the exceptions of:
Range can go up to 64 blocks.
Better entity filters, with blacklist and whitelist.
Pulse delay can be down to 0.25s.

This Entity Detector does detect Item Entities.

You start to get some more energy, and need a place to store it.
The Energy Core can hold quite a bit, depending on the tier.

To assemble the Energy Core, the need the Energy Core in the center, with 4 Energy Core Stabilizers, formed in a "+" around the core - these can turn any direction, and don't have to be at the same range.
Right click the Core, or a Stabilizer to open the GUI and activate the core.
To get to the next tier, deactivate the core (it will save the power, aslong as you don't break the Core), click the Tier Up, turn on the Building Guide and build as the guide is showning. Then Right-Click a Stabilizer and Activate the core.

To see the amount of energy, and blocks required for each Tier, check the Draconic Tablet.

You have your small Energy Core, but you wish to go bigger.
But if you want to go bigger, you need bigger Energy Core Stabilizers. You need Advanced Energy Core Stabilizers!
To get Advanced Energy Core Stabilizers, simply put 9 Energy Core Stabilizers in a 3x3 shape in the world. The center Stabilizier will determine the center of the Advanced Stabilizer.

§cNOTE: The Retrieval Task will also include the base 4 Energy Core Stabilizers for the T1-T4 Energy Core

To give and take from the Energy Core, you need Energy Pylons. One for Input, and one for Output.
Place them within 16 blocks range, and put a Glass Block either above or below the Energy Pylon, which will form the energy transfer ball.
Right-Click the energy transfer ball, to change it between Input and Output. The balls animation indicates which state it's in.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Give and take from the ball!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Advanced Energy Cores.
They're bigger, holds a lot more power and requires Advanced Energy Core Stabilizers. Thats pretty much it

§cNOTE: The Retrieval Task is for the entire ball, which includes the blocks already on the Energy Core. §lDo NOT break the center Energy Core block, or it will lose all its current stored power!

A Tier 2 Flux Capacitor.
Same rules applies as the Wyvern Flux Capacitor, but with more energy storage.
This is the only item that can receive a 4th RF Capacity upgrade.

The Wireless Crystals can transfer power from itself to other devices.
Just select the Wireless Crystal with the Crystal Binder and right click a device that needs the power.
The Wireless Crystal can not be turned into I/O Crystals, or back into a Relay Crystal.

There is a Wireless version of all 3 Tiers of Crystals.

You will need multiple Dragon Hearts you progress through Draconic Evolution.
But there's only 1 Dragon in The End, so you will have to respawn a new one some times.

You will need 4 End Crystals, each one placed on the middle bedrock at the edges of the Center Portal. This is also the vanilla way.
This will refresh all the Obsidian pillars, and its End Crytsals and then respawn the dragon
betterquesting:10.name:8: But I aint done with you yet!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
This is the biggest Energy Storage amount that any mod hold within a single single/multi-block structure.
But such storage also comes at a price. And a big one at that. 
Like the T5-T7 Core, it also takes Advanced Core Stabilizers.

This ball can hold a whooping §otakes breath§o §k§l§k§k§09,223,372,036,854,775,807 RF.
Have fun filling this badboy up.

Next tier Core for Draconic Evolution.
Gives super good efficiency on Resturbed Spawners

Should you ever need extra Dragon Eggs (which you probably will), this is the device for it.
Is it cruel? Probably. Is it neccesary? Also probably.
It is to be placed on the center bedrock, where the first Dragon Egg was, while the dragon is alive.

I mean, it is a magnet..

The magnet of Draconic Evolution. Doesn't require any power, and will drag in items and XP in an 8 block radius.
Shift-right click with it to toggle the magnet. Crouching will disable the magnets pull.

The Mob Grinder kills everything in a 7x7x7 infront of it, at ~500 RF per heart damage dealt.
Everything killed by the Mob Grinder will count as Player Kills, so Player-Only and Experience will drop. The XP Orbs only lasts for 30 seconds to reduce lag.

Can be turned off with a redstone signal
It is capable of killing Withers, but not Dragons. Damn those dragons..

The first thing you need to get started with Draconic Evolution is you need to find Draconium Ore.
Those ores are very rare in the Overworld, semi-rare in the Nether and very common in The End.
Most recipes requires Ingots, but some of them requires Dust. Draconic Evolution does not have a Crusher, so you can not turn Ingots into Dust with only Draconic Evolution


I do not recommend playing Draconic Evolution as a standalone tech mod.

The Advanced Dislocator is a portable device, that can save multiple locations to teleport to.
Shift-Right Click to open the GUI, where you can add, change, name and delete Locations.
Right Click a location in the GUI to teleport to it.
You can have 1 Quick Location on the Advanced Dislocator. Shift-Scroll with the Advanced Dislocator to change the Quick Location.
Right Click to teleport to the Quick Location.
Click on an entity (both passive and hostile) to teleport it to your Quick Location.
You can click on a sneaking player to teleport them to your Quick Location.

Every teleport consumes 1 Ender Pearl

Tools of the Wyvern.
They have no durability, but runs on Energy instead. Can mine in 1x1, 3x3, 5x5 and so on

Weapons of the Wyvern.
They have no durability, but runs on energy instead.
The sword has a small chance on kill to grant a Mob Soul (+1 Reaper). These souls can be used to change the type of a Stabilized Mob Spawner.
The bow uses regular Minecraft arrows to fire, so it is recommended to enchant it with Infinity.

The Draconic Information Tablet holds stats and brief explanations of everything in Draconic Evolution.
I will refer to this Tablet many times throughout this questlog.

"But why have this whole quest thing then?"
Because the tablet doesn't tell you how to progress, only what stuff is :)
The Basic Core of Draconic Evolution. Pretty cheap and easy to make. It's going to be a basic crafting component for a lot of things, including later Cores.

A single point, portable teleporter with 20 uses.
Shift-right click with it, to set its location. The location is fixed, and can not be changed, unless you craft a new Dislocator.
You can not recharge it either, and has no cooldown (so be careful with right clicking more than once).
This works cross-dimensions.

There are ways to exchange some things for infinite uses though...

The 2nd tier of Draconic Cores.
You may want to find an efficient way to kill Withers soon.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Add a bit of Wither to it..

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
It is time to awaken the draconium, with hearts.
You will need Awakened Draconium to upgrade pretty much all your stuff

The last tier of Draconic Cores.
This is mainly used for the Draconic Reactor.

Time to get Wither killing, because you will need a few stars for this!
It's time to upgrade the Crafting Fusion set, to the Wyvern Tier. This will unlock new crafting recipes to be made.
You only need around 8 for most crafting recipes, but there is 1 that requires 10.
I will let you go with 8 though.

You can mix-match the Crafting Injectors of different tiers, as long as the required recipe has all its materials on the correct tier or higher.

§1Note: Due to this being a Retrieval Task, you may have to break all the Wyvern Crafting Injectors for it to detect.

It's going to be a bit chaotic here.
The Chaos Dragon is the big bad boss of Draconic Evolution. You will need full Draconic Gear to have a chance against this Dragon.
You need to kill this boss for Chaos Shards.
The dragon spawns at every 10000 block in The End, at every direction like a grid. So it will be at 0x,10000y, 10000x,10000y, -10000x,0y etc.

Good luck, and have fun!
This block will prevent the Item Dislocators pull in a 5 block radius around itself.

The Flux Capacitor is a portable Battery, that can recharge your armor and tools on the go, so you don't have to return to base as often, or charge as many different things.

It has 3 modes. Charge Armor, Charge Held Items (items in your main/offhand) and Both.
To change modes, simply Shift Right-Click with the Flux Capacitor.
This Flux Capacitor does not need to be on your hotbar, but can not be in a bag (and still work)

I hope you grapped that Dragon Egg.
The Celestial Manipulator can change skies for the cost of power. 
It allows for weather: Sun, Rain and Thunder.
It allows for day cycle: Sun Rise, Midday, Sun Set, Moon Rise, Midnight, Moon Set, Skip 24 Hours and Stop at current position.

It can activate automatically on Redstone signal, but only for 1 function per Celestial Manipulator.
So you can set one up to make it permanent day so you don't have to sleep, or you can set it to never rain. How? Sensors.

This is the part where I sincerely hope you have some other power generation than Draconic Evolution! 

Item Fusion is Draconic Evolutions main crafting method.
You place the main item in the Fusion Crafting Core, and the fusing items on the Fusion Crafting Injectors.
Most recipes only requires 4-8 Fusion Injectors, however a few crafting jobs does require 10.

You will need to provide power to the Fusion Crafting Injectors, to do any crafting job. And you need quite a lot of it, which will take ages at 84rf/t.
After you have placed all the items, click the Start button in the Fusion Crafting Core, or give it a redstone signal.
Check the Draconic Tables for ranges on the Injectors and Redstone outputs from the Core.

This is the chest that can do, pretty much everything, with a whooping 260 inventory slots.

It has a built in 5 slot furnace, that runs on power, at 256rf/t. This furnace has 4 auto-feed modes.
Off: Well, it's.. off.
Fill: It will refill what is currently smelting with new items from its inventory.
Lock: It will always keep 1 item in the smelting slot, reserving it for that ore.
All: It will smelt every smeltable item that comes into the chest.
You can put a Core in its Core Slot, to increase efficiency, and it will Ore Double as well if you put a Wyvern or higher Core in it.

Its inventory can be split into different regions, and each of those regions can have their own I/O settings towards the chest, and the furnace.
Click the I/O Regions button to configure the 6 available color regions.

And it has a crafting table.

If you need more information, the Draconic Tablet should tell you what you need.

Next tier of Fusion Injectors.
Is needed for making Draconic Armor and Tools.
There is a recipe at the Draconic Tier requiring 9 Injectors, so you will need to craft 9 of them!

Again, you will need all of them in your inventory at once for the quest to trigger.

The final tier Fusion Crafting.
You will need 8 for the full upgrade on the Awakened Flux Capacitor.
If you want to delve into the Draconic Reactor, you will need 10.

The Potentiometer can do what the vanilla Comparator can, but easier.
You can set it to give a set redstone signal at all times, instead of filling an inventory to a certain amount for the Comparator to read.
This is useful when used with the Comparator in Subtract mode for certain things.
I'll leave that part up for you to discover..

(I'm just not creative with Redstone)

You will have to go to The End, and you will have to kill the Dragon. There's no way around it.
Now go kill it, don't forget the Dragon Heart, and the Dragon Egg!
betterquesting:10.name:8: She has to be brought down!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Tier 2 Weapons
Much more powerful versions of the Wyvern variants, with more and bigger settings available.
The Draconic Sword comes with +2 Reaper enchant.

Tier 2 armor.
Comes with more benefits available in the Draconic GUI, like Night Vision and Flight.
The shield from Draconic Armor will also make you immune to negative effects.

Wyvern Armor is the base armor of Draconic Evolution. It has no durability, and only runs on Energy.
When the armor is powered, it will provide you with a Shield, that blocks all incoming damage.
Everytime you take damage, it goes through your Entropy first, before it starts draining energy from the armor.
When the shield reaches 0, you start taking damage to your health.

The shield will make you immune to knockbacks from attacks, so mobs like Slimes are super deadly, and will drain your shield in no time.

Tier 2 Tools
Bigger and better than the Wyvern variants.
And if you're the type that would make Diamond Hoes, there's now good news for you.
There is a Draconic Hoe!
Used to charge items that can store Energy.

Draconic Evolutions only power generation before very endgame.
Accepts burnable items, at a rate of 84RF/t

The wires of Draconic Evolution, comes in 3 Tiers.
The Energy Relay Crystals are for moving energy around, and can accept many connections
The Energy I/O Crystals are for Sending and Recieving energy into the Crystal system, and can accept few connections
For capacity/link stats on the Crystal Tiers, check the Draconic Tablet

To configure the Energy I/O Crystals, you have to shift-right click them with an empty hand.
The way the Energy I/O Crystals work, you have to configure them like they're an Energy Battery rather than a wire.
If the Energy I/O Crystal is set to Input, it will take in energy to itself, from what it's connected to
If the Energy I/O Crystal is set to Output, it will give out energy from itself, to what it's connected to

To link the Energy Crystals to each other, check the quest to the left.

The Basic Tier has a link range of 32 blocks.

Next tier of Energy Crystals.
The Wyvern Tier can transport more RF/t and can have more connections.
May be a better option rather than 2 Basic Energy Crystals.

The Wyvern Tier has a link range of 64 blocks.

The final Tier of Energy Crystals.
Like the previous tier, it can hold more, and have more connections.

The Draconic Tier has a link range of 126 blocks. (Don't know why it's not 128)

The Dislocator Pedestal is well... a pedestal for the dislocator.
You can put a bound Dislocator on the pedestal, and it will act as a one-way teleport.
While the Dislocator is in the pedestal, it will not lose charges.

You can put another Dislocator Pedestal at the destination that teleports you back, making it a Point-to-Point Teleport system.

So you gain infinite uses, at the cost of portability.

You can also use your Dislocators to create a portal, leading to the Dislocator destination.
By connecting a Dislocator Receptacle with a frame of Draconic Infused Obsidian, and putting the Dislocator into the Receptacle, it will create a portal.

The requirements for the portal frame, is much like a nether portal - There must not be any holes in the inner frame (so you don't need to fill corners), however it can be any shape you desire, and can be flipped so it lies down.

This portal will teleport any entity that comes in contact with it, like dropped items, players and mobs. It will also teleport Withers that are still charging up, which makes it a good way to move it out of your Wither Spawning contraption, into a Wither Killing Chamber.

Upgrade Keys are used to enhance your Draconic Gear, Tools and Weapons.
The way you upgrade it, is to place the key in the Fusion Injection setup, and then give it the appropriate items to start the Infusion.
There's 3 tiers to every upgrade, apart from the Draconic Flux Capacitor, which can take a 4th upgrade.

The Keys are not consumed on the Fusion, so you don't need multiple of the same key
The same tier upgrades always takes the same materials, apart from the Key itself
You must apply the previous tier upgrade, before you can apply the next one
Higher tier upgrade requires higher Fusion Injection tier setup

§0§0§1§0This is Draconic Evolutions ultimate goal - The Draconic Reactor.
This is a reactor that runs on Awakened Draconium, that lasts a VERY long time (We're talking weeks of RL time on a server here).
After the setup has been made correctly, you right click the Reactor Energy Injector, or Reactor Stabilizer to open up the GUI.

The Core GUI has 4 lines:
§lCore Temperature: §0§0How hot it is. Higher means more RF produces, and higher fuel consumption. This also determines the size of the Reactor ball. If it touches the Reactor Stabilizers, they will explode, and thus, the Reactor will explode.
§lContainment Field Strength:§0 How strong the Shield is. This is what you Inject and draw RF from. If this reaches 0, the Reactor will explode.
§lEnergy Satuation: §0How efficient it is, in fuel to RF conversion. The higher the better, although it usually also means lower Core Temperature.
§lFuel Conversion Level:§0 How far it is with burning the current fuel. When this reaches more than ~85%, the reactor will start to produce uncontrollably.

§lFuel (In):§0 Takes up to 8 blocks of Awakened Draconium
§lChaos (Out):§0 Produces Chaos Shards as waste

The core fundementals of how the Draconic Reactor works is, you apply RF to create a shield around the around the core reactor where the RF production is happening. The RF produced is then applied to the shield, to make itself stronger. You then draw RF from the shield, and store it.

To start the Reactor, you need to put up to 8 Awakened Draconium Block and click Charge. This will begin to warm up the Reactor. You then need to pump at least 7 million RF into the Reactor Energy Injector for the shield. 
Congratulations, your Reactor is now running, and producing power

I highly recommend playing with this in Creative first, to get a feel for how it works, and how it can go wrong. And also just to see the pretty explosion!
For an optimal setup, or ComputerCraft script, I advise you to search on Google.
Supplied with EU and UU Matter, this machine replicates items. Set the desired item with a Pattern Storage, or a Crystal Pattern.
The Blast Furnace, when supplied with heat, turns Iron into Steel.
The lowest possible voltage. All machines can run on this without exploding.
Tier 2 voltage, 128EU/t.
Tier 3 voltage, 512EU/t.
Tier 4 voltage, 2048EU/t.
Glass Fibre Cable can transfer Extreme Voltage, EV, which is 8096EU/t. It also has the lowest loss of energy per block.
The Extractor's main use is to triple the output of Resin.
The Compressor lets you craft various compressed items, most notably Dense plates.
The Electric Furnace is faster than a vanilla furnace, and runs on EU.
The Metal former can turn various metals into the cable and plate counterparts.
This generator produces EU from lava.
Produces 1EU/t while exposed to the sun. Can be upgraded.
Produces EU from fluids such as Biogas, Biomass, Oil, Ethanol and Fuel.
Produces EU from kinetic energy - You need to pair it with a Steam Turbine, for example.

The Nuclear Reactor is capable of producing huge amounts of EU.
See https://wiki.industrial-craft.net/index.php/Nuclear_Reactor for additional details.

If you've never used the Nuclear Reactor, I highly suggest that you find a guide or tutorial.

The amount of EU it produces has been increased.
The Fluid/Solid Canning Machine is mainly used to make Nuclear Fuel Rods and Speed Upgrades.
The Block Cutting Machine can cut entire blocks into plates, and increase the Plank yield from Logs.
The Ore Washing Plant lets you get even more than double out of your ores.
This is an upgraded Electric Furnace. If you want it to operate it max speed, you will need to supply it with 1EU/t, and a redstone signal.
This machine is used to process Depleted Fuel Rods among other things.

Welcome to the Forestry chapter! .
Forestry offers power generation, automatic farms, in-depth breeding systems for bees and trees, and more!

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Forestry questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8: The Recycler produces scrap if you feed it with items and power. Scrap can be used to drastically reduce the amount of power needed to produce UU Matter.
The Mass Fabricator produces UU Matter at the cost of tons of EU, and optionally scrab.
You can store your UU Matter Patterns in the Pattern Storage. It's a good idea to place it next to the Scanner, for easy transfer.

Place items in the Scanner to see how much UU Matter it costs to replicate them. 

§4§lThis will destroy the item. §0

There are quite a few additional items that can be replicated, in addition to the normal ones.
The Carpenter is a machine used for crafting. Supply it with energy, a recipe, items and a liquid.
The Bio Generator generates EU power from Biomass or Ethanol.
The Thermionic Fabricator is another machine used for crafting. Supply it with energy, glass, a recipe and items.

Welcome to Immersive Engineering! This mod primarily offers large multi-block machines and cool aesthetical things.

§4The speed and energy requirements of the machines have been modified.§0

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Immersive Engineering questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Coke Oven produces Coal Coke, Charcoal and Creosote oil. Supply it with Coal or Logs.

I recommended that you use the quest rewards to build a §4§3§2Metal Press§0 - You'll need it to produce Steel Rods for the Steel Scaffolding.
Treated Wood is used in a lot of recipes in Immersive Engineering, and it's also a great looking building block.
The Blast Furnace produces Steel, when supplied with Charcoal or Coal Coke and Iron Ingots.
The Alloy Kiln is an early-game way to make alloys.
Early game power.
The Engineer's Workbench lets you craft some things with a discount, if you have the recipe.
Early game power.
A better way to make steel.
The Kinetic Dynamo produces power, when a Windmill or Watermill is attached to it, and running.
Welcome to the Extra Utilities 2! ExU2 offers over 15 different generators for RF production, and a bunch of nice miscellaneous gadgets and blocks.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Extra Utilities 2 questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You only have to obtain 9 Solar Panels OR 1 Manual Mill to complete this quest.

Extra Utilities uses a form of power called Grid Power, to power upgrades and the Angel Ring. It doesn't consume any ressources, it's passive power. The Manual Mill requires you to right-click it to produce GP, and the Solar Panels only requires the sun.

Obtaining any of the 3 Mills will complete this quest.

The Lava Mill produces GP from adjacent lava.

The Fire Mill produces GP from fire.

The Water Mill produces GP from flowing water.
The Dragon Egg Mill produces 500 GP from having a Dragon Egg on top of it.
The Resonator runs on GP, and can produce various crafting ingredients.
The Golden Lasso can capture passive creatures. You will need to craft it in a normal crafting table, and it requires 8 XP levels to craft.
The Cursed Lasso can capture hostile creatures, if they have 2 HP or less.
Drums are inexpensive options for fluid storage.
Drums are inexpensive options for fluid storage.
Drums are inexpensive options for fluid storage.
