Drums are inexpensive options for fluid storage.

Welcome to Actually Additions!
Actually Additions offers a wide variety of blocks and gadgets.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Actually Additions questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8: The Atomic Reconstructor is able to "reconstruct" some materials into others. Place or throw the blocks/items you want to change in front of it, and fire its' laser. By default, the laser will fire every few seconds.

The Empowerer is a crafting mechanic. You'll need to place the Display Stands with 2 blocks between them and the Empowerer, in all 4 cardinal directions.

The Display Stands require power for the Empowerer to function.

Each Display Stand needs a ingredient, and the Empowerer takes one aswell.

The crafting process automatically begins if 4 correct ingredients and the corresponding Empowerer item is supplied.
The Crusher is capable of crushing blocks. This can be used to double ores, and turn various blocks into other blocks.
The Powered Furnace is simply a Furnace that runs on power.
Enori Crystals are made with the Atomic Reconstructor, and are required in order to progress to Thermal Expansion.

Worms are acquired by tilling grass. They fertilize and till the grass/dirt around them, in a 3x3 centered on themselves.

They §4§4§0§4§0die after §410.000 ticks§0, in this pack.
The Fermenting Barrel refines the oil generated by the Canola Press.
The Canola Press turns Canola into oil, which can be used to generate power.
The Oil Generator generates power with the oil produced with Canola, and it's upgraded versions.
Crystallized Canola can upgrade the oil made by the Fermenting Barrel, when it's thrown into it.
Empowered Canola improves the oil even further. Like with Crystallized Canola Seeds, throw the Empowered Canola into the oil.
Welcome to Industrial Foregoing. It offers tons of different machines, that can automate a variety of tasks.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Industrial Foregoing questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8: The Stonework Factory makes Stone products, such as Gravel and Sand.
The Laser Drill, when pointed correctly and powered, will power the Laser Base, which in turn will produce ores. It uses 4000rf/t.
This machine gathers plants and trees.
Place in front of a tree, to extract latex from it. It will destroy the Log eventually.
When supplied with Fluid Latex and Water, this machine will make tiny dry rubber.
Rubber is a core ingredient in Industrial Foregoing.

This machine will kill animals to produce meat and pink slime. Place the Pink Slime in the world, to spawn a Pink Slime.

Sometimes you need to place the bucket of Pink Slime with 4 blocks around it, in order for the slime to spawn.
A lot of the Industrial Foregoing machines can upgraded.

The Laser Base, when powered by Laser Drill(s), will generate ores. It will need to have a clear line of sight to bedrock or void bellow it. You can apply lenses to it, to filter which ores to search for.
This machine kills mobs, when supplied with power. It generates a fluid you will need to duplicate mobs.
This machine sows plants above it. The placement is colour coded.
This machine simply feeds animals automatically.
The Fluid Crafter is an autocrafter, that takes fluids.
The Wither Builder places Soul Sand and Wither Skulls, to spawn a Wither. It's blastproof.
This gadget can, as the name suggests, imprison mobs.
The Mob Duplicator duplicates mobs, when supplied with power, liquid essence and a filled Mob Imprisonment Tool.
Welcome to Astral Sorcery! This is a magic mod all about harnessing the power of the stars.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Astral Sorcery questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Luminous Crafting Table is used to craft various things in Astral Sorcery.
The recipe can be found in the Astral Tome. 
Craft it in a Crafting Table, near one of the Floating Crystals found below some Astral Sorcery structures.
The Lightwell is used to produce Liquid Starlight. Place it with clear view of the sky, and place a Rock Crystal or Aquamarine in it, and wait for it to liquify. It only progresses during the night.
This has a bunch of different uses, most of which you'll have to find for yourself.
The Fosic Resonator will highlight areas that receive a larger than normal amount of starlight, but only at night.

This wand is used to complete crafts in the altars. It'll also highlight where you can find Rock Crystal ores at night. They're found at bedrock level.

The Resonating Wand can be crafted in a normal Crafting Table, if placed near one of the Floating Crystals, found bellow some Astral Sorcery structures.
Found rarely near bedrock.
... The Cave Illuminator illuminates caves.
Starmetal Ore is Iron Ore that has received a sufficient amount of focused starlight.
The Linking Tool is used to focus the starlight from crystal unto specific blocks.
The Looking Glass is used to identify and draw constellations.
The Celestial Crafting Altar is used to craft various things in the mod. To function, you'll need to place a multiblock structure around it, which you can find in the Astral Tome.
The Starlight Infuser infuses various materials and tools with Starlight. You will need to build a multiblock structure around it, which you can find in the Astral Tome.
The Iridescent Altar is used to craft various things in the mod. To function, you'll need to place a multiblock structure around it, which you can find in the Astral Tome.
The Ritual Pedestal can perform various rituals, based on which Attuned Crystal you supply it with.
The Grindstone is used to grind Starmetal into dust, and sharpen Crystals.
The Telescope is basicly an upgraded, stationary version of the Looking Glass.
The Starlight Crafting Altar is used to craft various things in the mod. To function, you'll need to place a multiblock structure around it, which you can find in the Astral Tome.

Celestial Crystals are basicly upgraded Rock Crystals. They're made by throwing 1 Stardust and 1 Rock Crystal into a bucket of Starlight. Let the Crystal that appears grow before you destroy it with a pickaxe.
Resonating Gems are crafting components, and are made in the Starlight Infuser.
Stardust is made by grinding/pulverizing Starmetal.
Collector Crystals are like the crystals found bellow some Astral Sorcery structure, but can be placed where you wish. They can empower a variety of things and blocks.
The Attunement Altar is used to Attune Crystals, and yourself. You will need to build a multiblock structure around it, which you can find in the Astral Tome.

Welcome to Thermal Expansion!

This mod offers a large suite of powerful machines. Energy usage and speed of all machines have been increased, some more than others.

The energy production of dynamos have all been increased.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Thermal Expansion questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8: The Pulverizer pulverizes stuff. It can double ores, produce Flint from Gravel, and a lot more.
A powered furnace.
The Sawmill cuts Wood Logs into Planks, giving 6 Planks per Log.
The Induction Smelter can double ores when supplied with Sand, Slag or Cinnabar, and make various crafting components.
The Cyclic Assembler in 1.12.x!
The Fractionating Still refines liquids, sometimes with by-products.
The Energetic Infuser can charge items that hold RF, and infuse some items into others.
The Fluid Transposer can fill/empty tanks and buckets, aswell as some items. It's used extensively through that pack - Some custom recipes will require you to upgrade it.

This Dynamo produces power from burnables and water.

To see all the ways to produce power with Dynamos, use JEI.
This Dynamo produces power from hot liquids.

This Dynamo produces power from a variety of liquid fuels, such as Liquifacted Coal and Refined Fuel, and water as coolant. See https://teamcofh.com/docs/compression-dynamo/ for the full list of fuels.
This Dynamo produces power from a solid reactant, and a liquid fuel, for example Destabilized Redstone and Sugar.
This Dynamo produces power from redstone.
This Dynamo produces power from Coins made in the Compactor with a special augment.
The Magma Crucible smelts items into liquids.
The Compactor can make Plates from Ingot. You can augment it in order to make other things, such as Gears.
The Glacial Precipitator is able to make Snow and Ice out of Water and power.
The Igneous Extruder uses Water, Lava and a little power to produce Cobblestone, Stone or Obsidian.
The Energy Cell has been configured to hold and transfer far more than the default. It's well worth making, especially if you upgrade and enchant it.
Slowly generates Water, passively. If adjacent to 2 or more Water Source blocks, the generation increases. Having more than 2 source blocks does not increase the speed further.
A fancy trash-can!
Increased the speed of nearby Thermal Expansion machines up to 60% per Thermal Mediator. The effect is stackable. The Thermal Mediator runs off of different kinds of coolants - the colder the better.
A by-product of processing ores in the Induction Smelter. Redstone Ore plus Sand is particularly good.
A by-product of pulverizing Gold and Redstone Ores. It can be used for crafting, and increasing the output of the Induction Smelters processes.
Extracts fluids from trees.
A by-product of refining Resin into Tree Oil.
Greatly increases power generation and efficiency, but Elemental Reactions may be used.
Allows for various gems to be used as fuel. Greatly increases power generation and efficiency.
Turns an applicable Dynamo into a Steam Boiler - It can only produce steam, not energy.
This is used to upgrade machines and gadgets in Thermal Expansion. Requires tier immediately preceding.
Allows for enchanted items to be used to generate power. This greatly increases power generation and efficiency. The enchanted item will be consumed in the process.
Greatly increases power generation and efficiency, but only Refined Fuel may be used.
Increases fuel efficiency.
Increases power generation.
Greatly increases power generation and efficiency, you will however need to supply coolant.
Converts a Steam Dynamo into a Steam Turbine. Energy generation is greatly increased, but Steam has to be piped in.
This upgrade allows the Compactor to make coins, used to produce energy. It must be set to "Mint" mode.
This upgrade allows fluids to be extracted from Logs.
Allows the Sequential Fabricator to craft things with fluids in their recipes.
This upgrade allows the Redstone Furnace to act as a Coke Oven.

The Matter Receiver can be teleported to.

See the RFTools manual for details.
This upgrade allows the Compactor to make Gears out of appropriate metals. The Compactor must be set to Gear mode.
This is used to upgrade machines and gadgets in Thermal Expansion. Requires tier immediately preceding.
This is used to upgrade machines and gadgets in Thermal Expansion. Requires tier immediately preceding.
See the RFTools manual for details.
This upgrade allows for rapid wireless recharging of Thermal Expansion Capacitors. The machine will be incapable of anything else.
This is used to upgrade machines and gadgets in Thermal Expansion. Requires tier immediately preceding.

This Card is useful for clearing out large areas of blocks.

See the RFTools manual for details.

A highly advanced Beacon alternative.

See the RFTools manual for details.

The Advanced Charged Porter can be bound to several Matter Receivers, letting you teleport between them.

See the RFTools manual for details.

This machine infuses RFTools devices with Dimensional Shards, improving them in various ways.

See the RFTools manual for details.

The Modular Storage, when equipped with a Storage Module, is a portable mini-AE system, storing up to 300 stacks of unique items. Note that non-stackable items count for 1.

See the RFTools manual for details.
See the RFTools manual for details.

Screens are able to display a whole bunch of cool things, aswell as manage redstone remotely, call elevators, and more.

See the RFTools manual for details.

A Power Cell for storing your RF. Power Cells can be wirelessly connected to eachother.

See the RFTools manual for details.

This Card can be used for building, with the Builder. 

See the RFTools manual for details.

The Matter Transmitter can be teleported from, to Matter Receivers.

See the RFTools manual for details.

The Dialing Devices lets you "dial" Matter Receivers, enabling travel to them from a nearby Matter Transmitter.

See the RFTools manual for details.

The Destination Analyser, when connected to a Matter Transmitter, enables you to check whether the Receiver you're dialing to has power.

See the RFTools manual for details.
The combination of Seed Oil and Wood Logs - It's required to make the Thermionic Fabricator.

The Matter Booster, when placed adjacent to a Matter Transmitter, allows it to spend extra RF to get you to your destination safely. With it, the Matter Receiver you're teleporting to can be completely out of power, without you dying.

See the RFTools manual for details.
See the RFTools manual for details.

Screen controlled Wireless Redstone!

See the RFTools manual for details.
The Squeezer is a machine used to get fluids out of items, like Seeds.
The Still can process Biomass into Ethanol, at a ratio of 10 Biomass to 3 Ethanol. Ethanol is an even better fuel source than Biomass.

The Portable Analyzer can analyze bees, trees and butterflies. It'll tell you everything there is to know about the specific bee/tree/butterfly you give it. For it to work, you'll have to supply it with honey.

The Rainmaker can make or stop rain. 

In order for it to make rain, supply it with a §4Iodine Capsule§0.

If you want it to stop the rain, give it a §4Dissipation Charge§0.
The Flexible Casing is a rather new addition to Forestry. It's used to craft non-multiblock forms of the various farms.
The Fermenter is used to make Biomass from Water or Fruit Juice, and Saplings.
The Centrifuge can be used to extract resources from §4Bee Combs§0, and a few soft blocks.

Forestry Multiblock Farms can farm all kinds of things, and are both fast and efficient.

See §1https://ftbwiki.org/MultiFarm §0for additional details.

The Apiary is an upgraded form of the Bee House. 

Put a Queen bee, or a Princess and a Drone inside it, and they'll start to produce their appropriate comb - if their requirements are met.

If you're looking to get into bee breeding, I highly suggest you watch a spotlight, or read a guide or two. Gendustry is in the pack, which simplifies the breeding quite a bit.

You will need to get the product of the bees found in The End to complete this pack, but no bee breeding is needed.
This Engine requires you to wind it up before it can generate power.
Some bees can harm, poison or even kill you if you're near them. The Apiarist's "Armor" will protect you from them.
The Peat-fired Engine produces power from Peat.
The Biogas Engine generates energy from a tiny amount of Lava, and Biomass.

Circuit Boards can be used to set the type of §4Farms§0, or §4upgrade machines§0.

In order to use a Circuit Board, right-click with a §4Soldering Iron§0, and put the Circuit Board in there. Depending on the Circuit Board, you'll have 1 to 4 possible slots for §4Tubes§0.
The Tubes you place in the Circuit Board determine the effects of the Circuit Board. You can read what each Tube does, in its §4tooltip§0.

You only have to make one of the Circuit Boards to complete the quest.
Tin Electron Tubes can be used to upgrade the Electrical Engine, or in Farms to set them to Manual Reed Farms.
Blazing Electron Tubes can be used to upgrade machine speed, at the cost of additional energy. They can also be used to set Farms to Nether Wart production.

The Thermoelectric Generator passively produces power, when a hot and a cold block is adjacent to it, on opposite sides. You can use up to 3 hot and 3 cold blocks per Thermoelectric Generator, and it will increase the power generated threefold.

Check the Engineer's Manual to see which blocks are valid.
This block is used for some Multiblock machines.
This block is used for some Multiblock machines.
This block is used for some Multiblock machines.
This block is used for some Multiblock machines.
This block is used for some Multiblock machines.
Metal Press Molds decide what the Metal Press should output.

The Projector can display how multiblock structures are supposed to be built.

Craft the Projector with an Engineer's Manual turned to the page of the machine you want to build, to set it.
Handy power storage - It's a great way to keep equipment powered. Shift-click to toggle between the different modes.

This nifty gadget can change the type of mob a Mob Spawner spawns. Pick the entity of your choosing by right-clicking it with the Spawner Changer, and then right-click a vanilla Mob Spawner to change it.

The Spawner Changer is used in the process.

You get Spawner Shards from breaking Spawners.
The Automatic Feeder does exactly that, just supply it with the appropriate food - Wheat for Cows, Carrot for Pigs, etc.
When supplied with power, the External Heater will power and increase speed of adjacent furnaces.
Blueprints let you craft various recipes in the Engineer's Workbench.
When supplied with power, the Farmer will till, plant and harvest plants in front of it, in a 9x9 area.

The Experience Solidifier does exactly what the name suggests. Store all your experience by clicking All.

Although it looks like it can only hold 1 stack of Solidified Experience, its internal buffer can store a lot more than that.

Right-click with Solidified Experience to get experience. Shift-right click to consume a stack.
The Ranged Collector will pick up item entities near it. It's highly configurable.

The Phantomface is essentially a block-proxy. By binding the Phantomface to a block, you can interact with that block by interacting with the Phantomface. 

This has a heap of useful applications, especially when it comes to automating machines.

Bind the Phantomface to a block with the Phantom Connector.
Handy power storage - It's a great way to keep equipment powered. Shift-click to toggle between the different modes.
Tamed Cats cough these up from time to time. They're not entirely useless.
Place the Fishing Net directly above water, and it'll automatically fish for you. It outputs to inventories adjacent to it
Greenhouse Glass speeds up the growth of plants underneath it.
LV, or Low Voltage, is the lowest power transfer rate in Immersive Engineering. In this pack, it's 2048 RF/t, per connection.
MV, Medium Voltage, can transfer up to 8192 RF/t, per connection.
HV, High Voltage, is the highest power transfer rate in Immersive Engineering. In this pack, it's 32768 RF/t, per connection.

The Deep Dark is a scary, dark cave dimension. It has §2twice the ore generation §0of the Overworld.

Something's lurking in the darkness, you better bring torches.
The Builder's Wand lets you place up to 9 of the same kind of block as the one you're looking at, given you have the blocks in your inventory.
Handy power storage - It's a great way to keep equipment powered. Shift-click to toggle between the different modes.
Handy power storage - It's a great way to keep equipment powered. Shift-click to toggle between the different modes.
Handy power storage - It's a great way to keep equipment powered. Shift-click to toggle between the different modes.
The Screen displays any imgur image, just give it an URL.
Players can walk straight through this, but mobs can't.
This Glass doesn't let any light through - Excellent for Cursed Earth mobfarms.

If you connect a Wireless RF Battery to energy, you'll be able to wirelessly power machines with the Wireless RF Transmitter.

Simply place the Transmitter, and it'll connect to nearby tiles that take power. Each Transmitter can at most output 80 RF/t.

Spikes are very useful for mobfarms. They deal damage to anything pushed up against them. 

Wooden Spikes reduce entities to half a heart, but doesn't kill.

They can be placed upwards, downwards and sideways.

Cursed Earth is made by right-clicking Dirt or Grass with a Drop of Evil, which is a rare drop from Wither Skeletons.

Cursed Earth will drastically increase the spawn rate of monsters on it, and the monsters that spawn will be extra strong and aggresive. Light completely stops the spawning, and the spread of it.
Used to create most Extra Utilities machines.
A simple powered furnace.
A simple powered crusher.

The Enchanter is used to create various materials.

It §2§0requires §0§2§0power and enchantment boosting blocks, equal to atleast 15 enchanting levels, nearby§0. 

§3§2§1§4§5§8§9§9§215 Bookshelves would do the trick.
The Angel Block is placeable mid-air - A great building tool, especially for floating bases.
This Generator produces power from burnables such as Coal and Planks.

Spikes are very useful for mobfarms. They deal damage to anything pushed up against them. 

They can be placed upwards, downwards and sideways.

Spikes are very useful for mobfarms. They deal damage to anything pushed up against them. 

They can be placed upwards, downwards and sideways.

Spikes are very useful for mobfarms. They deal damage to anything pushed up against them. 

Mobs killed with Golden Spikes drop experience.

They can be placed upwards, downwards and sideways.

Spikes are very useful for mobfarms. They deal damage to anything pushed up against them. 

Mobs killed with Diamond Spikes drop player-kill only items.

They can be placed upwards, downwards and sideways.
This Generator produces power from burnables like Coal and Planks.
This Generator produces power from food, the better the quality the higher the RF/t and total output.
This Generator produces power from Lava.
This Generator produces power from Lava and Redstone.
This Generator produces power from Ender Pearls.
This Generator produces power from potions - The more components used in the brewing of the potion, the higher the RF/t and total output.
This Generator produces power from pink items.
This Generator produces power from Milk and Slime.
This Generator produces power from cold items.
This Generator produces power from TNT.
This Generator produces power from burnables like Coal and Planks. It produces a lot of RF/t, but is very inefficient. The longer you have it running, the higher the output becomes.
This Generator produces power from enchanted books and items.
This Generator produces power from Dragon's Breath.
This Generator produces power from the "undead" items, like Rotten Flesh.
This Generator produces power from Nether Stars.
The Mechanical User can be used to automate nearly every player action, such as breaking blocks, clicking blocks, filling/emptying buckets, and a whole lot of other stuff.
The Scanner scans the block in front of it. It's extremely configurable.
The Rainbow Generator can produce stupidly large amounts of power. For it to run, it needs to have one of every Generator (except itself) from Extra Utilities nearby and running.
A Structure Frame block needed to make Tier 2 multiblocks.

Welcome to Botania! 

Botania is a magic mod based on flowers.

The flowers are split up in two main groups: Mana generating flowers, and functional flowers, which run on said mana.

The Lexica Botania is really comprehensive, so I suggest you search through it, if you run into issues within the mod. The easiest way, in my opinion, to find what you're looking for, is to open the book index and start typing - That'll open up a search bar.

If the Lexica Botania is in your inventory, you can hold CTRL on a Botania item, to open the corresponding entry.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Botania questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Pure Daisy can convert adjacent blocks to others. It's main use is for making Livingwood and Livingrock.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Livingwood is used in crafting.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Wand of the Forest is the "wrench" of Botania.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.
Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Mana Spreader is used for transporting mana.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Flowers are made in the Petal Apothecary - It needs a bucket of water, and you will need to drop a Seed in to finish crafting.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Manasteel is used in crafting.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.
Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Jaded Amaranthus generates Mystical Flowers on nearby dirt/grass at the cost of mana.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Mana Tablet can store mana - It's useful for powering your various Botania gadgets, such as Rods and Armor. 

Drop it in a Mana Pool set to output to fill it, drop it in a Mana Pool set to input to empty it.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Runic Altar is used for crafting runes among other things.

Place or drop the items needed for recipes, supply it with mana, and lastly throw a piece of Livingrock on top of it. End the crafting by right-clicking with the Wand of the Forest.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Open Crate immediately drops anything piped into it - It's very useful for automation.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Alchemy Catalyst lets you convert items into other items at the cost of mana.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Mana Pool can store mana for later use, and flowers can get the mana they need from them. Use the Wand of the Forest to link them.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Consult the Lexica Botania for information on how to summon the Gaia Guardian.

§4Hint§0: If you can't find anything about the Gaia Guardian in the Lexica Botania, try throwing it in the Alfheim portal.

The Thermalily converts lava into mana. After "eating" lava, it goes on cooldown for a while, before it can eat again.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Soujourner's Sash increases your run speed and jump height, and gives you Step Assist. It requires a tiny amount of mana to function.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Manaseer Monocle shows you the area of effect of flowers, while you're looking at them.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Terrestrial Agglomaration Plate is used for crafting Terrasteel. It must be placed in a 3x3 multiblock consisting of the plate, Livingrock and Lapis blocks. Place 5 Livingrock in a X pattern, and place the Plate on the middle Livingrock. Then fill it with 4 Lapis Blocks.

Drop 1 Manasteel, 1 Mana Diamond and 1 Mana Pearl on it to initiate the craft. 

It takes half a Mana Pool worth of mana.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Sparks can rapidly transport mana between them.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Terrasteel is used in crafting.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.
Consult the Lexica Botania for information on how to summon the Gaia Guardian II.

These are the blocks required to form the gate to Alfheim.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

You'll need 2 of these to open the gate to Alfheim - Place them over mana pools.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

These Pylons are part of the ritual required to summon the Gaia Guardian.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Livingrock is used in crafting.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.
Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Kekimurus eats adjacent Cakes and turn them into large amounts of mana.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Gourmaryllis converts food into mana - The better the food, the more mana is produced.

It needs to be fed alternating foods, so it doesn't get sick of one type. 2 different foods will suffice.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.
Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Munchdew eats nearby Leaves and converts them into mana.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Entropinnyum absorbs nearby explosions and converts them into mana. 

For a short duration after an explosion has been absorbed, the Entropinnyum will be unable to absorb another - causing the explosion to actually go off. Use with care!

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Solegnolia blocks magnets from working in an area around it. It does not require mana to function.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Narslimmus feeds off of Slime chunks - Whenever a Slime spawns, it destroys it and turns it into mana. The bigger the Slime, the more mana is produced.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Orechid generates ores in nearby Stone, at the cost of mana.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Dropped from the Gaia Guardian II - What could be inside?

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Clayconia converts nearby Sand blocks into balls of Clay, at the cost of mana.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Pulse Mana Spreader will fire a mana burst, if it has enough mana, whenever it receives a redstone signal.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Conjuration Catalyst lets you duplicate items at the cost of mana.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Bellethorne deals damage to nearby entities at the cost of mana. 

It does not harm players.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.
The various Space Suit parts can be modified in the Suit Workstation - You can add things like a jetpack, and padding to boots.

The Holo-Projector is a device that can project 3d blueprints of the various multiblock machines this mod adds.

Sneak + right clicking will open a menu that lets you select which multiblock you wish to make. Once you've selected one, simply right click on the ground to place the blueprint.

The blueprint will tell you which blocks need to be placed where, along with possible alternatives, in order to fully assemble a given multiblock machine. Sneak + mouse scrolling will change which layer is currently displayed.

Once you're done with your construction, you can simply right click the controller block of the machine to finish it.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Advanced Rocketry questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Orechid Ignem generates Nether ores in nearby Netherrack, at the cost of mana. Must be in the Nether to function.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

This Wand exchanges blocks for another block of your choice, at the cost of mana and said block. Just like an Exchanger.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Shard of Laputa has the ability to raise a chunk of land from the ground, into the sky. Right-click the ground to use.

It has 20 levels, each level increasing the size of the chunk raised.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Rod of the Seas can generate water, at the cost of mana. Right-click to place a water source block. It can fill the Petal Apothecary.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Band of Mana is a wearable Mana Tablet.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Rod of the Terra Firma is an incredibly powerful tool. At the cost of large amounts of mana, it will raise or lower the ground around you, to the level you're standing on.

If you keep a Rod of the Lands on you while you use this, the mana cost of placing dirt will be lessened.

It can destroy most stone-type blocks.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

If you hold right-click with the Horn of the Wild in your hand, it'll harvest all crops and grass in a large radius around you.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

If you hold right-click with the Horn of the Canopy in your hand, it'll harvest all leaves in a large radius around you.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

If you hold right-click with the Horn of the Covering in your hand, it'll harvest snow layers in a large radius around you.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.
A simple, cheap jetpack. Charge it with EU.
A crafting component.

RTG Fuel can be used to produce EU passively in a Radioisotope Thermoelectric Generator. 

It's also a crafting ingredient for some endgame items.

A faster Mana Spreader.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The absolute fastest Mana Spreader.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Several multiblock machines in this mod make use of either Coils, Motors or both.

These come in several tiers, with the more expensive ones making the machine work faster, but any given machine will accept any of them.
Sticky Resin is extracted from Rubber Trees, with a Treetap. Sticky Resin can be smelted to make rubber, but it's far more efficient to process it in an Extractor.
The Mining Laser is a mining tool. It has several different modes you can choose from.

Spark Augments change the way Sparks behave, they can be very useful, especially for automation.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.
Tiny Piles of Plutonium come from processing depleted MOX or Uranium Fuel Rods in a Thermal Centrifuge.
The CF Sprayer can be used to spray Construction Foam. Construction Foam can encase IC2 cables to form facades.

If you have the Benevolent Goddess' Charm equipped in a bauble slot, it will drastically reduce damage you take from Creeper explosions, and nullify the explosion itself. It requires mana to do so.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

The Rod of the Plentiful Mantle will highlight nearby ores when you right click, at the cost of mana. This is especially useful for finding NuclearCraft meteors.

Consult the Lexica Botania for additional information.

Iridium is an extremely rare material, used for Tools and crafting. It's a great idea to automate the replication of this.

You can find Iridium Shards in dungeon loot, and the Shards can be compressed into Iridium Ore.

The Electric Arc Furnace is a big multiblock machine that can heat things a lot using RF.

Follow the blueprint provided by the Holo-Projector to assemble it. There are 11 blocks in total in the structure where Input or Output Hatches can be placed, otherwise you'll need to put Heatproof Bricks. The requirements on this quest is the minmum of 1 Input and 1 Output Hatch, with the rest being Bricks.

Once built, right click the Electric Arc Furnace block once to finish it, then another time to open its UI. Turn on the machine using the switch on the top left and you can now use it.

To use it, put your input in the Input Hatch, check the progress in the Electric Arc Furnace block, then get your outputs from the Output Hatch. Most machines from this mod behave in similar way so be sure to remember it.

The main use of this Furnace is to make Steel from Iron and Charcoal, Titanium from Rutile Ore and Silicon Ingots from Sand. All of them are used in several crafting recipes later on. All of these items can be obtained through other means aswell.

The Cutting Machine is a multiblock machine that is used to cut things using RF.

It can be used to turn wood Logs into Planks much more efficiently than by hand, but is mostly used in the making of Basic Circuits, a crucial component for later on.

The Precision Assembler is a machine that can assemble electronics much more efficiently than by hand using RF.

Its main use is crafting the various Circuit Boards, used to craft various machines, for a much cheaper cost than their normal crafting recipes. It is also used with other machines in making Basic Circuits for more advanced machines.

It is recommended to make this machine as soon as possible, as it drastically cuts the cost of other machines.

The Crystallizer is a multiblock machine used to make various crystals using RF.

Its only uses are turning Dilithium Dust into Dilithium Crystals, which will be used to fuel a Warp Drive later on, and making Silicon Boules, a component in making Basic Circuits for more advanced machines.

Basic Circuits are an essential crafting component made using the Crystallizer, Cutting Machine and Precision Assembler. They're not the only component that require this processing chain, but they're the most used ones.

To make a Basic Circuit, first make some Silicon in your Electric Arc Furnace, turn it into a Silicon Boule in the Crystallizer, cut it into Silicon Wafers using the Cutting Machine, assemble them with the required components in the Precision Assembler, and finally cut the result in the Cutting Machine.

The Lathe is a simple machine used to make Rods much more efficiently than by hand, using RF.

You should consider making it relatively early, as it is cheap and can cut down a lot of material cost in the long run.

The Rolling Machine is a multiblock machine that uses RF and Water to make Plates much more efficiently than the Smal Plate Presser.

Its other uses include the ability to craft Sheets of various materials, as well as Pressure Tanks that allow to easily transport higher quantities of fluid than Buckets.

It is recommended to make this machine early to cut down the metal cost of crafting the various components required by other machines.

The Electrolyser is a machine that uses RF to turn Water into Hydrogen and Oxygen.

Both of those fluids are needed later on to make Rocket Fuel as well as to be able to breath in space with the Space Suit.

The Chemical Reactor is a multiblock machine that uses RF to make various things.

Its two main uses are combing Hydrogen and Oxygen into Rocket Fuel, and adding the Airtight Seal enchantment on armor.

An armor piece with Airtight Seal can be used to substitute any piece of the Space Suit when going into any planet without atmosphere or in the vaccuum of space. Just like the Space Suit though, a Chestplate enchanted this way still requires to be filled with Oxygen.

The Gas Charge Pad is a simple machine that can fill items with Hydrogen or Oxygen without using RF.

Simply pipe in the gas you want and insert any container that you want to insert the gas into.

Most importantly though, standing on top of it with either a Space Suit Chest-Piece or a chestplate enchanted with Airtight Seal equipped will fill it with Oxygen. This is required to not die when on a planet with no atmosphere.
The Gravity Controller lets you control the gravity of your Space Station.

The Rocket Assembling Machine is a multiblock structure that will allow you to make Rockets to go into space. This first quest will only detail how to build the structure.

Start by placing Launch Pad blocks in a rectangle on the ground. It can be anywhere from 3x3 to 16x16. On the same level, place a Structure Tower near one of the side, then stack up more of them to make a 1 block tower. This tower can be anywhere from 4 to 64 blocks tall.

Finally, place the Rocket Assembling Machine itself one block above the level of the Pads, with the back of the machine facing the Pad, and plug it with RF. If you did this correctly, it should no longer say "Invalid Launch Pad Structure".

Then you need the Fueling Station to be able to fuel your Rockets. Place it somewhere near the Assembling Machine, plug it with RF and your source of Rocket Fuel, then sneak + right click it with a Linker, then sneak + right click the Assembling Machine with the same Linker.

Building a Rocket is the last step before getting to space.

The Rocket needs to be built on your Rocket Assembling Machine, with the Launch Pad blocks delimiting the horizontal space you have and the Structure Tower the vertical space you have (you can't go higher than your stack of Structure Towers and can't go out the rectangle of Launch Pad).

A manned Rocket needs a Guidance Computer, a Seat, at least one Rocket Engine (a better version can be crafted once you got Titanium Iridium Alloy) and at least one Liquid Fuel Tank. There are no other restrictions that apply, your Rocket can be as unrealistic as you want so long that you respect the above points.

To check if your Rocket is actually capable of reaching space, go on your Rocket Assembling Machine and click Scan. It will both tell you how what's missing as well as various stats, as follow :
-Thrust : how much thrust the Engines are providing
-Weight : how heavy is the Rocket, most blocks have the same weight but blocks with inventories can be heavier
-Fuel : how much fuel capacity you have, increased by adding more Tanks; the white line is the amount required to reach orbit, and thus you should always have more than that
-Acceleration : how fast will the Rocket accelerate on a planet with as much gravity as the Overworld; white bar in the middle is 0 m/s² so you should always be higher than that

When your Rocket is ready, click Build on the Rocket Assembling Machine. You can then right click to board it or sneak + right click to open its inventories and check the fuel level.

Finally, insert your Planet Id Chip in the Guidance Computer's inventory, then in the Rocket's inventory click Select Dst, select Luna either on the map or through the Planet List, and click Select.

Make sure you have a full Space Suit (or full armor enchanted with Airtight Seal) filled with Oxygen, then board the Rocket and press Space. You will then arrive on Luna. To go back, select Earth like you selected Luna earlier, board the Rocket and take off again. You don't need as much fuel to take off from Luna.
The Warp Controller is used to set the destination of your Space Station.

The Space Station Assembler is used to assemble Space Stations.

You will need the same setup as for building Rockets, the only differences being Space Stations don't need fuel, and when they're built, they compress into item form.

The item then needs to be launched into space, with a rocket with a Satellite Bay. The rocket will be lost, unless you give it a Guidance Computer with the Space Station ID Chip in it, in which case it'll land on the newly made Space Station.

You can travel there by making a Rocket, and placing the Space Station ID Chip in the Guidance Computer.§4 Make sure to always have backups of your Space Station ID Chip!

The Oxygen Vent, when supplied with Oxygen and power, will fill the room it's in with oxygen, given that it's airtight.

The size it can fill with oxygen is limited, but large.

Your Rocket needs fuel to work. The following liquids are viable rocket fuels:

Rocket Fuel
Refined Fuel
Pyrotheum
Neutron
Liquid Oxygen
UU-Matter
Liquid Starlight
You'll need a Space Suit, or an otherwise air-tight armor set, to survive in space.

Satellites can be used to collect data from celestial objects.
 
See "http://65.78.115.159:8000/AdvancedRocketry/items/satellite.php" for specific details.

The CO2 Scrubber, with Carbon Collecting Cartridge in, will decrease the amount of oxygen the Oxygen Vent uses.

You can place up to 2 next to a Oxygen vent - the rotation of the CO2 Scrubber matters.

The Carbon Collecting Cartridges will be destroyed over time.

Building a Warp Core multiblock in your Space Station will allow you to travel to other planets and solar systems!

It uses Dilithium Crystals as fuel.
A crafting component.

The Astrobody Data Processor is a multiblock machine used to research Asteroids, when provided with information from satellites.

Asteroids contain extremely rare metals in abundance. Asteroids have been custom made for this pack.

See "http://65.78.115.159:8000/AdvancedRocketry/guides/Missions.php" for more information.

It's §4extremely§0 important that you don't lose your Space Station ID Chip, once it has been set to your Space Station.§0 If you lose the chip, and don't have any other means of transport to the Space Station, it's lost.

Luckily, it can be copied in the Satellite Builder multiblock.

Before you're able to get to space, you can craft Titanium Ingots.

Titanium can be found in space, as Rutile Ore.

Welcome to NuclearCraft! This mod is all about generating massive amounts of power through Nuclear Fission and Fusion. 

The trickiest part of this mod is without a doubt figuring out how to get the various nuclear fuels and isotopes - JEI does show how to obtain it all, but there are often several steps.

0:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the NuclearCraft questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8: An extremely rare ore, found in space.
An extremely rare ore, found on moons.
An extremely rare ore, found in space.

Welcome to Environmental Tech!

This mod features large §4multiblock machines§0, like the Solar Controller and the Void Ore Miner.

The multiblocks can be §3automatically assembled§0, if you right click with the Assembler on the Controller block that you wish to build the structure for.§4 It'll tell you the materials you need.§0 Once the materials are all in your inventory, right click the Controller with the Assembler again, and it'll build your structure!

In order to progress through the mod, you'll need tons of §2Litherite §0to start off with. Use that to build your first Void Ore Miner (Tier 1) - which will mine§2 Litherite§0, and the next tier crystal, for you. Build the next tier Ore Miner with your newly acquired crystals, and repeat the cycle until you reach Tier 6.

1:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Environmental Tech questline!

It's also used as a crafting component in the recipe of a few other machines.

The higher the tier of the Ore Miner, the faster it runs. Certain ores can only be obtained from the highest tiers of Ore Miner - JEI shows which ores are obtainable, and the chances to get them.

The Speed Modifier can be used instead of a Modifier Core. It increases the speed of the Void Miners, at the cost of additional power. 

You can stack them, but the power requirement will rise exponentially.

The Piezo Modifier can be used instead of Modifier Cores in the Solar multiblocks.

It will generate power when it's raining, and you can stack them.

The Accuracy Modifier can be used instead of a Modifier Core. It increases the accuracy of Colored Lenses in both kinds of Void Miners, at the cost of additional power. 

You can stack them, but the power requirement will rise exponentially.

It's a pretty complicated structure, so I highly advice that you watch a spotlight on it, or read through a guide.

The mod has been heavily tweaked.

An upgradeable mob spawner. 

You can set the type by combining a Broken Spawner with a filled Soul Vial in the Soul Binder, and then combining the Broken Spawner with the Powered Spawner in an anvil.
Allows you to paint most blocks, and some machines, to show a different texture.
The Angel Ring gives you creative flight while it's in your inventory, or a Bauble Ring slot. It needs 32 Grid Power to function.

Welcome to Blood Magic! 

Blood Magic is a magic mod centered around gaining power from sacrifice.

It offers a lot of cool gadgets such as the §1Sigils§0, not to mention a variety of building blocks.

The §6Sanguine Scientiem §0contains information on nearly all of Blood Magic, so for the most part, I'll be referring to that.

2:10.command:8: /say VAR_NAME has begun the Blood Magic questline!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The first thing you'll need to do is craft up some Rudimentary Snares.

Throw the snares at hostile mobs until white particles appear, and then kill them.
If you're lucky, they'll drop Demonic Will.

The drop chance is affected by Looting.

The Blood Altar is the main crafting mechanic of Blood Magic - It infuses Life Essence (Blood) into items to transform them.

It's a multiblock structure, that gets bigger with each tier. You can use the §4Inspectoris Scandalum§0 to visualize where the runes and such should be placed.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Since the altar grows downwards with each tier, it is recommended you plan ahead accordingly. Currently, the altar is only implemented until tier 5, with tier 6 requiring creative mode spawned items. Keep that in mind when laying the foundations!

Your next tier of blood altar will be able to use runes to empower itself. 

At this level, only the 4 runes in the cardinal directions will be used, but surely there is a way to yet further empower it...

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

The power of blood is undeniable. As your altar grows, so does your power.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

You will not be denied. The most powerful of runes are but slaves to your altar.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

It is done - a monument to your ample might. 

Try working out rune synergies, build multiple inter-linked altars, or build a ritual of (self-)sacrifice into your very altar - you are far from done.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

The Tartaric Gem holds Demonic Will for use in crafting, and empowering certain tools. The higher tier, the higher storage. This gem stores up to 64 will.

Sentient tools will use the will of the upper-left most gem in your inventory. Using a sentient weapon will charge your gem by killing mobs without using a snare. The more will you already have stored, the more damage it will do, and the more will is collected.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.
Extending your storage capabilities, this gem hold up to 256 demonic will. Your power grows...

Your commitment finally paid off. This gem stores up to 1024 demonic will. 

Living armor is within your reach, and if you have a sentient sword and at least 500 will, try dropping it to let it fight for you (it can be re-collected with a shift+right click, or after it dies).
None shall oppose you. This gem stores up to 4096 demonic will, providing ample storage for your sentient tools, weapons and armor to draw from.
Your masterful control of wills has peaked. This gem stores up to 16,384 demonic will. What to do with so much power...?

Slates are magically charged pieces of stone. They can be crafted by placing a smooth stone block on a blood altar with blood available. A tier 1 altar can only produce blank slates, but as the altar grows, so does its ability to charge the slate further.

Slates are used for many recipes, but first and foremost they enable the creation of runes that can be used to extend and empower your blood altar.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Blood orbs are used to transfar life force from either yourself or your alter into your storage, or "network". They are also used for certain crafting procedures, and are usually not used up. The tier of the orb dictates how much life force it can ultimately store in your network, and what recipes you can attempt using it.

This orb can charge your network to a maximum of 5,000 LP.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

This slate grants access to runes empowering the giving of blood to your altar - whether willingly or otherwise.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

The Apprentice Blood Orb will be useful in crafting of sigils and runes. It will also charge your network up to 25,000 LP.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

This slate grants access to the runes of displacement, allowing for quicker exchanges between the altars internal tank, and the rune of capacity, additively stacking runes that increase your altars main LP storage.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

The Magician's Blood Orb unlocks even more powerful sigils and runes, and the master ritual stone, your starting point into ritual magic. It also charges your network up to 150,000 LP.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

This powerful slate unlocks the rune of acceleration, increasing all tick-based mechanics of the blood altar, and the rune of the orb, increasing the speed at which an orb can supply your blood network.

It also allows you to upgrade your runes of capacity into ones with smaller initial storage, which then stacks multiplicatively - the more you have, the more powerful they become.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Limitless power is nearly within your reach. Can be used for several powerful recipes and stores up to 1,000,000 LP in your network - enough to call down the heavens themselves, if only once before it needs to be recharged.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

This slate is powerful enough to attract the attention of dubious entities offering power... for a price.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Unlimited power is at your fingertips. Charges your network up to 10,000,000 LP.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Used on the master ritual stone in order to activate the ritual once all the runes are in place.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Used near a Blood Altar to "donate" blood.

The dagger can be charged by a nearby incense altar to aid the process. The altar will work on its own, or can be expanded into a multi-block structure for much larger benefits!

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Arcane ashes enable you to hold simplistic rituals to create new items. One ash will last you for several uses. Draw a transmutation circle, then add items with a right click. First put in the reagent (left part of the recipe), then add the catalyst (middle part of the recipe).

These items are required for most sigils and equipment such as the living armor.

See the Sanguine Scientiem (or JEI) for details.

This Sigil lets you see more detailed information about the Blood and Incense Altar. It also enables you to check how much LP are in your blood network.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Used to place Ritual Stones for Rituals. Right click on the Master Ritual Stone to place runes automatically. Bear in mind that some Ritual Stones might need to be placed below the level the Master Ritual Stone is in. 

Cycle through available Rituals with Shift + Click.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Blood Magic has a lot of different rituals that perform tasks such as create lava, grow crops, and damage enemies. 

The more powerful versions can be used to automize sacrifice to the blood altar, wether from players or mobs, or even calling down a ressource-rich meteorite.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

A hellfire forge is used to craft certain items using demonic will. A recipe will usually have 2 will components - minimum will required, and will consumption. You can check both by hovering over the arrow displayed in the crafting recipe. In order to meet some minimum will requirements, you need to upgrade your tartaric gems to increase their capacity!

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Kill hostile mobs with the Bound Blade for a chance to get Weak Blood Shards. Bound Weapons use your Blood Network to power themselfs - or your life force, should you run out.

§1§4Activate the Blade with Shift + Click.
§0
The chance is affected by Looting. 

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Can place Dusk runes in addition to the 4 basic types, unlocking the most powerful rituals.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

Used to activate the most powerful of rituals, including calling down a fragment of the stars.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

The Ritual Tinkerer can be used to move the affected area of a Ritual.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

A stronger, more in-depth Divination Sigil.

Does not work on incense altars.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

The Dagger of Sacrifice can be used to sacrifice mobs near your Blood Altar. The amount of blood you get depends on the mob, with hostile mobs usually being worth much more than harmless critters.

See the Sanguine Scientiem for details.

You need proper food if you want to survive this modpack. This'll show you which foods are available to you, and how to easily make them. This questline revolves around Pam's Harvestcraft and Cooking For Blockheads. Authored by NillerMedDild & TurtleMiauw.

Authored by shigure1408.

Mekanism is a very technical mod that includes everything somebody could ever need. 
Simple machine setups for those new to the whole Tech side, with easy ore processing, lots of misc items and low RF generation (~60rf/t), and really complicated machine setups for the maximum profit, like complicated ore processing (upto x5 processing), machine automation and really high RF generation (200k+ rf/t). 
Mekanism is a big mod, so the quests will be split into 2 parts. This is Part 1, that includes the Basic and Advanced parts of Mekanism. 

Disclaimer: You are expected to know how to look up recipes in JEI (Just Enough Items). 


Authored by Discomanco.

This is Part 2 of Mekanism. 
This is where things starts to take a step up in complexity, which means that there will be no more "funny/silly" descriptions, and focus mainly on the explanation of the machines. 
Part 2 includes The Elite and The Ultimate parts of Mekanism. 

Authored by Discomanco.
Advanced Rocketry is a tech mod centered around going to and exploring space. Authored by NillerMedDild.

Draconic Evolution is a late-game, super powerful mod, with (arguably) the strongest armor, weapons and bosses available to any mod.
It offers the biggest Energy Storage available, big and dangerous power generation, super powerful armor and weapons, mob spawning and killing and more.
Draconic Evolution has its name of being the Power Creep of Modded Minecraft, because it does everything bigger and stronger.
